I was there for a small conference, and spent most of my time either at my computer in the room, asleep, or at the conference. the rooms do include free wifi but expect to pay for parking (the fee is reasonable). there is a tiny business center downstairs (two computers connected to a single printer, all in plain view of the front desk) that guests can use free of charge. i didn't notice any noise issues and thought the service was decent. the hotel was pricey but i think that's normal for that part of seattle (and still less expensive than downtown seattle, where my next conference was!) i'm not sure if the hotel provided the meals i ate at the conference but if yes, i can vouch that the food is decent also. i'd recommend it if you need to stay somewhere close to U.W.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: TravelL0ver28
Reviews.Content: I went on a paid business trip for three days with this hotel. I checked in with three of my other co-workers at the same time. We each gave our credit card so they can hold a $60.00 deposit. When I woke up the next morning, my account was drained. The Hotel Deca charged me for my room which was already paid for plus other service fees.They only could offer well it would be back in your account in 3 to 5 business days!!! No apologies at all, I was 2000 miles from home with no money to eat or anything. Thank God for my co-workers who loaned me some money. Finally I was able to talk to a competent person, the last day of my trip (still with no money and service fees from my bank racking up) . She offered me a free breakfast and a complimentary shuttle ride to the airport since I didnt have any money. Or at least I thought, but two and a half weeks later my account was overdrawn again by this Ridiculous hotel at 11:30 at night. I couldnt believe this crap. WTH, after almost an hour on the phone with my bank setting up a fradulent charge and puttting in a claim , I was able to talk to another rude indidvidual who said"look I dont wanna waste your time cause there"s nothing I can do. I then gave him all the info. my bank said fax them so they can take the charge off and he said he didnt have acces to a fax machine. Can u believe that. Im going to be sure to talk to my HR, and let them know this is not a good hotel at all. The work ethics and morals of this place is real low. Oh and P.S I wasnt the only one out of our company who had problems, just the worst!!!! The free Wi-Fi was horrendus, kept freezing up, my anti-virus spyware kept detectincg malicious activity that would harm my pc. No pool, No spa & for 140 a night. Please...I can go stay in the O.C for that price with a pool, and a hot tub, and free breakfast every morning of your stay, free shuttle, excellent food at the restaurant and a real fitness center. Save your money go somewhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: chris1311964
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in the heart of the university district. The hotel has a great staff, big rooms and a great shuttle that will take you to the market and seattle center. We stayed in a king room (1008) and had a nice view of downtown. There are a lot of good coffee shops and great Thai restaurants in the neighborhood. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms big enough to relax in with a couch and small refrigerator. We came from Philly to see the Phils/Mariners and really enjoyed our trip to this beautiful city and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, close to UW, would return on next trip”
Reviews.Author: hank_le
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated hotel, simple but elegant room, decent bar downstairs with live music (jazz, jazz fusion). This hotel was a 10 minute walk from UW, and there were lots of college-town restaurants in the area. Staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: Snakemanmark
Reviews.Content: I booked a Junior suite on the 14th floor specifically to watch the Fourth of July fireworks over Lake Union. The view was outstanding and I managed to capture quite a some good pictures of the fireworks. The beds were comfortable, there were lots of good quality pillows and Egyptian cotton sheets were luxurious. At about 160 bucks total I can't complain about the value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: anonymous753
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca turned out to be a truly pleasant travel experience. I was only going to be in Seattle for one night. I wanted to stay in the city, but that initially didn't seem practical given the extra expense. Hotels near the airport seemed like a better idea. However, I did a little searching, and found The Hotel Deca using the "Name Your Own Price" option on Priceline.com. Not only did it turn out to be a place to stay in the city that was better than the average accommodation near the airport, but I also paid less for it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, comfy - a great relaxer for big stress!”
Reviews.Author: sfp25
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room before major surgery since this was a hotel close to UWMC. The beds are so comfortable, the staff has been friendly, helpful and great! the breakfast isn't free, but worth the price, so don't pass up this hotel just because breakfast isn't included. As compared to other hotels in Seattle with shuttle service to the hospital, this is worth the $20 difference. I got a street level room for my mom and it's large and comfortable. My boyfriend got us an upgraded room and, while it does have some upgrades, like a couch and a larger area, two people can still be very comfortable in the street level rooms. The only complaint I have is the shower. i would love more pressure, and a more regulated temperature, it jumps from comfortable to hot multiple times in a short shower session.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: ArtLadyOlympia
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the hotel, I unexpectedly needed to work on a lengthy document, but did not have my laptop. No worries at Hotel Deca! The hotel's lobby houses a small but well-eqipped business center, complete with internet access, a printer, etc. I was able to plug in my flash drive and work on my document, print it out, and email it, etc. The business center was available 24 hours a day. My stay in Seattle would have been very stressful had it not been for the amentities of this wonderful hotel. They've earned my loyalty!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vacationcrazy27
Reviews.Content: So fun to stay somewhere that doesn't look like every other hotel! Loved the quirky furniture and decor. The location and adjoining neighborhoods were very fun and the staff was friendly and knowledgable. Free parking and free internet-Awesome-Loved it and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, could use a few small improvements”
Reviews.Author: Estrella2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend last weekend and overall was very happy with it. We were there for a show across the street at the Neptune so it was extremely convenient. The decor of the hotel (in both the room and common areas) is really stylish and attractive. The District Lounge is a great place to have happy hour drinks and food from 4-6 pm. Having a Tully's coffee shop in the lobby is convenient too. My only complaints are: - There should be a fan in the bathroom. It gets really steamed up, especially w/more than one person taking showers. - It would be nice if they had bathrobes for guests -- obviously not essential, but other boutique hotels I've stayed in for similar prices have offered this amenity! - I asked for a view & paid for "city level," but my view was basically a parking lot. We were put on 4th floor directly across from the elevator, which made it kind of noisy when guests were standing outside our door waiting for elevator. - The shuttle service proved to be useless for us, because every time we asked about using it, we were told it was all booked up. Even when we asked a day ahead of time about getting a ride to the train station the next day, we didn't have any success in reserving it at the appropriate time, so we had to take the bus instead. But I would stay here again -- none of the "cons" I listed above are deal-breakers! The bed linens were so extremely soft & comfortable, the flat screen TV was nice, and all the staff were very nice & helpful. Wireless internet worked fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice!”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1176
Reviews.Content: I got a bargain on Priceline during a busy Seattle weekend when downtown hotels were crazy expensive. I like the U district, so I knew I wouldn't mind staying there. The decor is a bit over the top, but you'll appreciate the amount of effort they went to make every detail fit in the art deco theme. Fun! It was spotlessly clean, and the bed was high end with lovely duvet. All the conveniences you expect at this star level. Right next to bus stops that take you downtown or to capitol hill, fremont/ballard, or wherever you need to go. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Allanadler
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, housekeeping and front desk especially.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice with a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: VivaVerdi
Reviews.Content: This is a complete revamp of the old Meany Hotel. The rooms are nicely done and the bed is superb, (I second the comment on the awful scratchy toilet paper.) The staff is helpful and friendly. The large free parking lot is welcome in a neighborhood with scarce parking.The views are great from the upper floors. and if you have business at the University of Washington, it is two blocks away. The walls are thin and the plumbing is old - meaning spurts of hot and cold water in the shower. The negatives: Wireless is lousy with a poor signal that sometimes quits/ The lamp by the bed is indeed stylish but the light is very poor making reading in bed difficult. At least on my floor, for several hours there were big bags of trash in the hallway taht appeared to be left by the maids. Several suggestions There are no public laundry facilities but there is a laundromat in the parking lot across Brooklyn. They offer drop off servuce. This is a student neighborhood so fine dining is not an option. There are a lot of good options about a mile east. Go to Yelp and search for Seattle restaurants:in Laurehurst.

Reviews.Title: “"I have stayed at Hotel Deca 2 times and will stay there again!"”
Reviews.Author: RickeyGillespie
Reviews.Content: Every time i go to Seattle and am staying in the University District near UW i will stay at Deca. It is a very nice hotel with excellent service, nice rooms, great bar/restaurant, free wi-fi, and is super convenient to everything on campus. The staff go out of their way to help you with whatever you need. The lobby is super cozy and it was still sufficiently cool that the fireplace in the lobby had a nice fire going all the time! In the bar/restaurant, the bartenders make very informed recommendations about local beer and wine, pouring samples first, and the food is excellent! Great value-you won't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in the U District”
Reviews.Author: CPBoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last weekend of the Seattle International Film Fest since all three of the movies we were seeing were playing at the Neptune Theater kitty-corner from the Deca. The decor throughout is very well done and upkeep/cleanliness was good. Although the room was small, the unusual shape, smart furnishings and large sunny bay window made it seem more spacious and on the whole it was very comfortable. The bathroom was tiny, but well renovated. The free parking in a lot just outside was great. Staff friendly, helpful and sincerely cheerful. My only gripe (except for the scratchy TP in the bathroom) was room service quit at 1000 on a Saturday night - no cold sandwiches, salads, snack - nada. Would definitely recommend to colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the U District”
Reviews.Author: 4ceebee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week (paid for by my work). It is really conveniently located near the University of Washington, and so convenient to get to by public transit. The hotel is a little tired (water pressure not great), but it's very clean, and the staff go out of their way to make you happy. The District bar and restaurant was great - yummy food and good conversations. The views in the rooms facing downtown is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: SherryJean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day before our Alaska cruise. The price was great and they provided free parking for 8 days and a shuttle to the cruise ship terminal. The staff were very friendly from making the reservation to leaving the hotel. The hotel was clean and beds very comfortable. I would highly recommend a sky view room which overlooks the space needle.The neighborhood is fun and there are lots of great stores and restaurants around. I will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crabzilla
Reviews.Content: Hotel Deca is an interesting boutique hotel. It is an older hotel which has been renovated in which they have tried to keep the "boutique" feel. The entrance, lobby and other common areas therefore are appealing because of interesting design or furniture elements. A drawback of this approach however is that a number of less attractive or convenient features were also kept. I stayed with colleagues on a business trip and we had a number of rooms in the hotel. The rooms were relatively small,somehat too small for some, and the bathrooms tiny. So you might want to check on the size of the room before you accept it. My room still kept it's old sink, which was cracked and chipped. The very thin shower curtain was insufficient and couldn't keep the whole bathroom from getting wet during showering. Views varied. Some were great with a view of Mt Rainier on a clear day. My room viewed the rather unappealing University of Washington district area. An absolutely big plus for this hotel is the very friendly and attentive staff. Check-in and check-out were very efficient. The manager was very present and attended to our needs. The free internet worked well. The restaurant was again fairly small and the breakfast below average. Don't even try the 'fresh'OJ. However, this was made up by the great Tully's Coffee store which can be directly accessed from the hotel. In summary, if you are looking to get away from large chain hotels and stay in an interesting place, and have business in the University area, than try the Hotel Deca. If you are strict on luxury and convenience, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and attractive hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: PhotosOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Deca with my friend in our first trip to Seattle and it was great! The complimentary shuttle was amazing and took us to all the major sites, and picked us up at a pre-arranged time. We couldn't have asked for more. We were in the sky level room which had an amazing view over Seattle, extremely comfortable beds and all the space we could ask for. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “value for money and boutique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: sans265
Reviews.Content: We are very happy to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Seattle. The overall experience in this hotel is top Class. Staff is extremely gracious and welcoming. I would definitely stay in this hotel, next time I visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: natyoung
Reviews.Content: I want to like it 100% but I can't... GOOD - clean, interesting decor - free shuttle service is great - all staff is extremely friendly and helpful - University District isn't the nicest area but it's interesting BAD - thermostat in room didn't work - rooms were small even though we got upgraded - having to pay for parking (which their site says $12 but their phones and reservation people say is $10) - we asked for a refrigerator sent up (free of charge) but it never appeared - definitely an older hotel. new renos try to hide it but can't hide everything - thin walls, cracking corners on walls, cold faucet provided a trickle of water. - no free breakfast - internet was very spotty It was a good stay but I probably would look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “More style than substance”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideLecturer
Reviews.Content: It's one of those "boutique" hotels that tries to make up in style for the real substance of a good hotel. So, there's a throw on the bed that's a gesture towards a 1930's fur, but the porcelain in the sink is cracked and the towels are not terribly soft. I gave up waiting to be served breakfast -- you get a $2.00 voucher on check-in, which strikes me as somehow worse than nothing-- because there was only one waiter who was overwhelmed by having a dozen or so people to deal with at once. Being ignored for ten minutes when you need your morning caffeine is not so great.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: PDXBeerGoddess
Reviews.Content: Reasonable prices, spot-on staff (with a sense of humor), beautifully appointed rooms and public spaces -- all that plus a great little lounge and restaurant and a good location puts Hotel Deca on my short list for where to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, pricing, and location for a 'boutique' hotel ~ AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: kwanjo1972
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at a 'boutique' style hotel. I have stayed at Marriot Live in LA, Sheraton, Westin, and other chain hotels/resorts and this establishment is above the rest! Don't get disappointed when you enter the room as they are not the biggest ~ like most hotel unless you pay for them (e.g., rooms vs. suites), but the closet is huge for luggages and comes with the safe deposit box - useful for people needing it ~ although I did not use any of the goods in the closet (e.g., iron, ironing board, dresser, and hangers). I actually like the layout better as the the room is for sleeping and not for storage when on a trip which for travelers knows exactly what I am referring to ~ limited room storage and leaving clothes/luggages on the floors. Hotel DECA may not be the top hotel chain with the limited facilities (e.g., pool), but the location has easy access to everywhere. The Hotel Complementary Shuttle ~ within 4 miles radius can get you to most of the tourist places ~ including the Northgate Mall or Downtown ~ job well done! Only wished it was complimentary parking or included in the hotel price. However, once I parked, the hotel shuttle took me everywhere I needed to be ~ as suggested or as the staff recommended I drive and enjoy the best of Seattle has to offer ~ scenic view. I had my roof off my Jeep Wrangler and with clear sky ~ what better way to see Seattle! The best part... the staff were all amazingly helpful since this was my first time to Seattle. They printed me maps even with other guest standing behind me which they immediately call someone in the back or one of the Shuttle drivers to assist me while they helped the other people in the line-up...that's service! You see ~ lots of time I feel annoyed when the hotel reps don't care to help but needs to which you can see it on their faces while the people in the line up gets annoyed. I witnessed first hand for the first time what teamworks mean in a hotel environment when 4 hotel reps at the first desk are assisting/helping 4 guests at the same time for a smaller 'boutique hotel' ~ lucky to have 2 working at the desk. I was amaze at the professional and 'INVITING' persona of this hotel. This hotel made my trip a success. I was told by multiple Seattle residences that I lucked out to have 3 clear-blue skies in a roll which they have yet to witness over the past 4 months... could not ask for a better trip and Hotel Deca was a major factor. Keep up the awesome job and see ya next time. Regards, Johnny K

Reviews.Title: “Unique place...I would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sandi228
Reviews.Content: The customer service was excellent, from the front desk to the food service to the cleaning staff. The building is an older building, with some of the disadvantages of an older building, but everything was spotless, updated nicely, and completely comfortable. I was traveling alone, and I felt very safe. It's in a great location if you are doing anything on or around the UW campus. I love the decor--retro look because of the older building, with an artsy-feel because of the furnishings. Oh, and the view from my room was spectacular. I hope to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in my travels-location is perfect and I like the free shuttle services”
Reviews.Author: Aylin34
Reviews.Content: Hotel Deca is a must stay in Seattle - perfect if you are a walker-Uni district-tons of shopping and away from the downtown and noise-free shuttle is a really nice bonus-loved it so much will return in 2 weeks timeo AYLIN

Reviews.Title: “Not authentically Art deco, but still sort of charming”
Reviews.Author: infinitime
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Hotwire. It was our first time staying in the University District, as we wanted to be away from downtown. The hotel is charming, in a pseudo-Art Deco style... Though many of the fabrics and patterns were more 1970s than 1920s, it was still a fun place to be. The rooms were older, but reasonably clean. The location was great, being within walking distance of both University Blvd (where all the funky eateries were), and within a two minute drive to the U of Washington campus. We also ventured further west to the University Village, being a somewhat affluent neighbourhood about 1.5 miles to the west. We did not try the restaurant, so we can't comment. Sadly, the night we stayed there was a prom/grad party of sorts in the ballroom, and our otherwise peaceful stay was interrupted by the sound of Hiphop and the occasional argument/fight in the hall. We were somewhat disappointed by the fact that parking is only included with their package deals, so we had to foot the tab for $12 plus tax in the adjacent outdoor lot. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Pat076
Reviews.Content: Visited the Hotel Deca in late April Room was spacious, view was great! Bathroom was a little small but sufficient. Nice sized closet, could use a light in there. The only negative comment was the availability of the van, it was nice to use around town but there is only one and scheduling should be done in advance. Otherwise, I really enjoyed my stay. Staff were very nice and helped me with directions. Much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, style”
Reviews.Author: NDorman14
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, I booked online at Priceline and called the hotel to confirm the bed-type for our reservation. The staff on the phone went ahead and did a complimentary upgrade to a room w/ a better view since it was our first stay there. The rooms were updated w/ a deco/modern flare and very quiet! Location wasn't bad. It was great for us as we wanted something less expensive than staying right downtown Seattle. Parking onsite was $12/day. The only thing I'd change would be the pillows :) The feather filling was too loose for me, they just went flat when you lied down. But a nice sleep anyway!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: KenBlaine_Washington
Reviews.Content: A degree if comfort that would usually be twice the cost. And the location is perfect if you need to be in the U District.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: yasmilan
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and great location. we didn't love the beds (they were just replacing them...) and there was a bit of a noise late at night in the corridor. other than that it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic hotel...great location and room views”
Reviews.Author: janeangela
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 14th floor and it was very quiet and we had a spectacular view of Seattle Center.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: aluap_j
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the minute we enter the hotel we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff! The room had a great night view of Seattle (could see Space Needle in the distance) and was one of the best maintained and cleanest hotels that we have stayed in in a long time. It was roomy as well. The location was great for the short walk down â€œThe Aveâ€� to UW. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, service, location but some maintenance overdue”
Reviews.Author: shs56
Reviews.Content: My sister and I always stay at Hotel Deca when coming into town for the UW's Meany Hall concert series. We find good value, amazingly good staff service from the front desk, restaurant and cleaning staff. We love the nighttime city view -- particularly from the Sky Level. I think its been enough time since the initial renovation that a refresher needs to be done to keep the Art Deco feeling sparkling and alive.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irv6182
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. I would stay here next time even if I have business downtown. They offer a free shuttle with very friendly and helpful drivers. The entire hotel staff goes out of their way to be helpful. If your visit is connected to UDUB then this hotel is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: JKCDMom
Reviews.Content: The Deca is a gem in the University of Washington area. If you have kids at U Dub....stay here..I was put off , at first by the no air conditioning, BUT...open the window and you are fine...it will be a little loud at first, but its manageable...bathrooms are a little small..but again, quite nice. We will definitely stay here again. The staff is very helpful...the beds and pillows are amazingly comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: Ozman006
Reviews.Content: Four nights, excellent service, quiet, very comfortable, great value for money. Also, in my case, perfectly located for work with colleagues at UW.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet with a good view”
Reviews.Author: Bentracer
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay. The room was clean and comfortable with all furnishings in good to excellent condition. The room was very quiet and the bed comfortable in our king mini suite on the tenth floor. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the University of Washington. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.... but”
Reviews.Author: johnwgorman
Reviews.Content: I really want to give the hotel a great review. I tend to search out boutique hotels wherever I go. Funky can be very nice. There is a lot to like about the the place. The decor was whimsical and fun. The bed was comfortable with plush bedding and clean crisp sheets. The bathroom was very cute with a true art deco throwback theme. The staff were super helpful and polite. The view was superb. The location awesome. But there was a gaping fault: cutting corners in maintenance that gave the place a "cheapness factor." Under the exterior window in my room was significant water damage. I don't know if the window had been left open during a previous rainstorm (or a few storms) because the wall underneath it was disintegrating. The drywall was crumbling and I could see deep into the wall. It really looked bad. I could say it started to spoil the stunning view out the window. It wasn't a small spot that could be overlooked. The damage covered several feet, the whole wall sagged and there was damage to the window sill as well. I can't imagine this had just happened (it wasn't wet) or that the management didn't know about it. This sort of dilapidation is something you find in a roach motel not a 3.5 star $150 dollar room. The thing that was most incongruous was the fact other parts of the room were very nice and well maintained. Why the blinders to this gaping fault? Was it cheapness? Some other things that might drive customers away. The upholstered furniture in the common areas of the lobby should be shampooed more often because there were darkish dirt spots on the top of chairs where people's hands often touched (you know... those pink squarish chairs in the lobby photos). Again... gives an impression of cheapness and isn't that tough to make right! Exterior paint on older wood-framed windows of basement bar was rotten and looked bad... Repeat... cheapness factor. (To give the hotel credit on this one... they mentioned on the website that there is a future 5 million dollar exterior renovation scheduled!) Having said all this, I would like to emphasize that with a little attention to detail this hotel was just inches from being an EXCELLENT experience. If they didn't cut corners in certain detail areas I would say it was worth every penny and definitely could measure up to its 3.5 star rating. Here is to hoping!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything!”
Reviews.Author: rocknrollgirl
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed everything about the hotel. The room was good, the staff was good, food was good and the bartender in the lounge made one of the best manhattans I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “stylish and comfortable hotel next to University of Washington”
Reviews.Author: vacyclist27
Reviews.Content: My son and stayed here while touring the University of Washington. We stayed in a Queen suite. The room was large and well decorated. The beds were comfortable and there was a chaise lounge near the window! The staff was friendly and gave us a good recommendation for dinner. The parking was convenient. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is truly a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Baseballgirl1958
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Deca based on recommendations on Trip Advisor and Expedia and we're so glad we did! We had medical appointments at the UW Medical Center and since we didn't relish the thought of round trips from the coast two days in a row, we went looking for a hotel in the area. The Hotel Deca truly was an amazing find! We knew that it was an older building, but it didn't feel that way when we got inside. The lobby and rooms were warm and inviting and very comfortable. The room was nicely appointed and the bed was comfy and very welcoming after a hectic day of medical tests! The staff was very gracious and genuinely seemed interested in making our stay the very best it could be. I can't say "thank you" enough for making what could have been a stressful trip very relaxing! We will be back and we will definitely be staying at the Hotel Deca when we do!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AprilDogTucson
Reviews.Content: Great service, reasonable prices, very luxurious and trendy. If you can ge a special on Priceline or another site, this is a great place to stay. This is very close to the University of Washington, so parking can be an issue if the lot is full. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: iluv2travel_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were touring the University of Washington, so the location was great for that. The hotel was very modern and stylish, and we were surprised by how nice our room was. I recommend getting a room in an upper floor- the view is amazing. The room was bigger than many and had a walk-in closet! The bathroom was nice, and had enough towels and some nice shampoo/body wash. I slept really well, the bed was very comfortable. Oh, there was even an ipod radio with a dock. My new ipod touch (newest generation) didn't work with it though :( Some hotels don't have an exercise room, but this one does. It seems to have a good amount of equipment (for a hotel) and I would've taken advantage of it had I stayed longer. I also highly recommend the restaurant in the hotel- The District. They give you a $2 off coupon (and you'll need it, the food is a little pricey) but it's SOO worth it. I got the biscuit meal for breakfast and it was amazing. The staff down there are very friendly, and the service was fast. The menu is in your hotel guide, so you can see all they have to offer. Overall it was a great experience, and I only stayed one night! I definitely recommend it, especially if you're looking for a hotel near the University. Also I should note that there's plenty of food options nearby, a block away along University Way.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo9213
Reviews.Content: The location was just minutes from my meeting. Staff were friendly, cordial, welcoming and efficient. However, the property is beginning to show its age. The room was stuffy and too warm. Even turning the thermostat down to 68Â° did not help. Bathrooms show steam damage in the form of the edges of the wallpaper pulling away from the walls. Overall, I would stay again, but my expectations have been lowered based on this and previous stays.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, clean and comfortable with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: jbragg86
Reviews.Content: This certainly seems to be the best option if you are looking to stay in the University District. The prices are pretty reasonable given the quality of the hotel. The lobby is very nicely furnished with a fireplace and an almost cozy feel to it. The room was spacious and clean with comfortable beds and trendy furnishings. The staff was friendly and helpful. They also have a free shuttle which will transport you to downtown or anywhere else within 4 miles and you can even schedule them to pick you up, which sure saved a lot of money cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: laberna1
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights while my son was in the UW medical center. I cannot overstate how friendly & helpful the staff were. From the front desk folks to the wait staff, shuttle drivers, etc. I had to make a couple changes to my room & check out day & it was all handled with no problem what so ever. My bed was super comfortable & the food served was outstanding. My son will be returning to UW Medical center & I will be back staying at Hotel Deca.

Reviews.Title: “The place felt like home, a very upscale home!”
Reviews.Author: Papa98765
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our time in the hotel very much. Staff was very friendly and clearly wanted to be helpful. Spent 10 days visiting a new grandchild using hotel as a base. They were flexible with our uncertain schedule, willing to give us the room on a day by day basis after our initial reservation. Parking lot right outside-not so common in a city.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience I have ever had with a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaHissong
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the best experiences we have ever had with a hotel. The hotel Deca was just as it appears on their website. The room was very clean and extremely comfortable. It was the best night sleep I have ever had away from home. We will most definatley be staying here again and i recommend this establishment to anyone who asks. THANK-YOU HOTEL DECA!!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for”
Reviews.Author: ColoMoon
Reviews.Content: Just recently had the opportunity to work in the UW area, and surprisingly the only hotel I ever came across was the Hotel Deca. Everything about this hotel was easy...the check in, the parking(free), the access to all the dining and shopping areas around the UW area. I had a king room, on the 6th flr, with an unobstructed view of the Space Needle and part of downtown, if it wasn't for the tall building across the street, I could have seen all of downtown, and then some. The room was very comfortable, well furnished, and fairly quiet as well. The TV was nice, with an included DVD player if you have your own movies. The bathroom is really made for one person at a time, as it is a bit cramped, but still the tub is big and wide, and the water temp and pressure was not an issue. I enjoyed walking into the lobby with each arrival, with the fireplace cozy seating areas. All of the employees I came in contact with were very helpful and efficient, I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The knowledgeable, professional and friendly staff make this an excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: AAY001
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and will do so again....at least as long as my child remains at UW. The hotel is well managed. The experience from reservation to arrival to stay to departure compares with luxury hotels in terms of personal attention and friendliness. If there is a notable detracting feature it is the limited exercise facility. Bring along a TRX! The hotel is not luxurious but makes up for that in cleanliness and comfort as well as very good value. The free shuttle service is a nice touch and makes getting around for the uninitiated out of towers easy. The GM Don is extremely approachable and very responsive. His front desk manager, Max, and revenue and guest services manager Senada are superb and attentive. I particularly like the top floor suites. Lovely balconies made for cool crisp evening with friends, wine and tapas! Try this hotel. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, comfortable beds, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: SB972
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Deca twice and I can't wait until I get to go back. The restaurant is fantastic too!

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: arcturianak
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel at a resasonable price. Front desk staff are excellent. Room was spacious (except the very small closet) and the bed was very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: geoperky
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Friendly staff, decent price, good parking. I know where I am staying when I visit Seattle next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: sra48
Reviews.Content: What a great experience at Hotel Deca! From the moment you walked into the lobby the staff was friendly and professional, greeting guests with smiles. The lobby of the hotel is super cozy with the fireplace and often was filled with guests chatting at the tables and chairs. Parking was a breeze and was at a great price (only $10 a night!) compared to other hotels. The hotel is in a great little area with all kinds of restaurants/bars within walking distance. I'm a female and was traveling by myself and felt very safe and comfortable in the area. My room was clean and I loved the Art Deco throughout the hotel. I was staying during Valentines Day and saw many couples come in and out of the hotel to enjoy their nights and the restaurant downstairs was packed. It was definitely a great experience and I would reccomend the hotel to others traveling through.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarkZ-PDX
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for Valentines day from Portland, OR, and we loved it! The views of downtown Seattle were great. The staff was very nice and speedy and I won't stay anywhere else if I was going to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Nice play to stay”
Reviews.Author: mander1981
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel with terrific staff, whimsical art decco decor, great vibe”
Reviews.Author: JerseyD
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Deca. Large room (ours had two queen beds) with stylish yet comfortable furniture. Staff was incredible, accomodating and friendly. Great bar and restaurant downstairs. Super location just a couple blocks from UW campus.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience, again”
Reviews.Author: degord
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively on business and this was my second visit. Deca is the perfect antidote for road warriors tired of the boring sameness found in the chain hotels. Deca has real character, a terrific staff, and an excellent restaurant. The rooms are cleverly decorated, quiet, with good and quiet HVAC, comfortable beds, and complimentary wireless internet. I look forward to my next trip to Seattle and stay at the Deca.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gardener60
Reviews.Content: I loved The Deca! The decor, the staff, the room, the restaurant, the price. The location's proximity to good restaurants, a marvelous bookstore and all the University has to offer,makes The Deca a hotel I will stay in again. Downtown is only 10 -15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “off the usual Seattle trail”
Reviews.Author: jmbstudio
Reviews.Content: The Deca was nicer than the usual cookie cutter accomodation. The Hotel from the 30's is nicely updated and has great style and a great rate. The U district location allows you to be in a community rather than a parking lot. My only complaint was a musty room odor but that was short lived. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in years”
Reviews.Author: mschultzie
Reviews.Content: I have been absolutely impressed with the staff and experience here at Hotel Deca. The rooms are well decorated and clean, the view (if you pay the extra few dollars) is gorgeous. I made the mistake of going downtown for entertainment and dinner the first night, but the second day I realized there is much more food and entertainment options here in the University area anyway. The hotel is just one mile from an upscale but friendly shopping center with everything from Barnes and Nobel to Tiffany. The best part is the staff. Everyone was friendly, respectful and pleasant from the manager that checked me in to the shuttle driver that provides complimentary service to downtown or the space needle. This is not a Marriott, don't expect cookie cutter design. Boutique is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: caveman4
Reviews.Content: I booked our room through Priceline and after I read some reviews and warned my husband we may be in a double bed. He said he didn't care. Well we arrived after a day of travel and had a speedy and friendly checkin and then up to our room. We had a corner room on the 4th floor with a king bed and a chaise and free internet. We were very pleased with our room but were hungry as it was 9 p.m. and went downstairs and the desk clerk directed us to the lounge. We received great service from the bartender and delicious food. My husband had a homemade chicken pot pie which is a treat after a day of traveling. We slept great as the bed was very comfortable and it was not noisy at all and it was Saturday night so I don't know what some of the comments are about. In the morning we went downstairs for breakfast based on the referral of the bartender and once again a great meal and really friendly service. Checkout was simply pay for our parking and out the door. I can say we will stay here again as it was very close to great shopping and we really enjoyed the decor and atmosphere as well as the pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best option if you want to be on the UW campus”
Reviews.Author: GOPADRESGO
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Deca many (8?) times in the past year, and we've also tried the other motel/hotel options around the UW campus. The Deca is the best option in the UW campus area. The rooms are quiet, and the windows open. There are decent views from the upper floors. Nothing fancy, and personally I'm not a fan of the "pedestal" antique sink style where you don't have any counter space, but with that minor "complaint", the rest is fine. After trying several spots in the area, The Deca is definitely the best for us when visiting our UW student. (Hey, if you're not going to the UW then why are you looking outside of Downtown Seattle in the first place!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice option in the U-District”
Reviews.Author: septemberfalls
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, reasonably priced option in the U-District. The staff was really accommodating, the decor is tasteful and the rooms are large with comfortable beds. Won't blow your socks off but it's great for what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Deca has provided consistently excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: I always look forward to my stay at Hotel Deca. I've been going there for years, and their service always exceeds expectations. The Hotel Deca folks goes out of their way to make sure they do everything to insure your comfort. They are very accommodating in every way possible. The quality of service and caring comes from everyone you meet, including accounting, the front desk, housekeeping, the dining area....everywhere. You always feel so welcome. The rooms are reasonably priced. Rooms are great if you are traveling on business. There is a wonderful lounge area downstairs with a fireplace. Close to the University of Washington.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with hotel and the staff was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: alanndon
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel from a list online through American Airlines Vacations. You never know what to expect when you are picking a hotel site unseen online. We were very pleased with the room and the staff. It was conveniently located to get to the university hospital. The lady that checked us in was very professional and nice. Our registration was entered late, we made last minute reservations to visit someone at the hospital, and since we had to wait a few minutes (less than 5) they gave us free parking. Couldn't ask for better service or nicer staff. The room was very clean with comfortable beds for sleeping. The bathroom was very small, no counter, but was clean and had a deep tub for a hot bath! The room was warm and comfortable. The free wi-fi was great and we had no problems accessing it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: DobsonRoofing
Reviews.Content: Originaly had a room on the 4th floor and the very friendly clerk upgraded me to the 12th floor with no extra charge. The room was very clean and the veiw was awwesome. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and smelled very clean. The only problems I had were thata the remote needed new batteries and the shower head was more like water coming out of a hose than a shower. Other than that the stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: destinationvaried
Reviews.Content: I have been eating or staying at this hotel since the 1960s, when it was still the Meany Hotel. I saw its major renovation 20 or so years ago and have stayed many many times. PROS: This is quite a nice hotel with a long and flourishing history. It must be called a Seattle classic--would be nice if the hotel could provide photos of the old Meany and Towers hotels with some information on its history in the lovely lobby, particularly for old Seattlites who loved the old hotel. The hotel has a beautiful stylish lobby with great atmosphere and boasts a convenient location for a U-area hotel (easier "in and out" than the nearby Watertown Hotel). It is a quick trip downtown by car or bus. One can reach the Fairview/Mercer area downtown by means of easy-to-travel charming "lesser roads," if one is not inclined to take the busy and crowded freeway. There is a coffee shop in the lobby although it is quite a chilly place on a winter morning, so we took our coffee to go. There were complimentary newspapers and a very kind and friendly staff at the front desk. The beds were very satisfactory, although our quilt was worn and too thin to suffice. We added one from storage and were able to manage. The TV was a flat screen and very good. There was a nice desk. (The lamp light in the room was a little dim overall for one doing heavy reading.) The views in this hotel are truly wonderful, although the traffic noise is a little loud given the convenient location at a busy intersection with buses. (One must be careful to turn on the ventilation; this prevents a headache or similar from the occasional fumes rising from the street.) We used earplugs which we bring when we travel. We had no issues with noise from adjoining rooms or those above: this was great! CONS: The room was adequate although definitely appearing more aged and frayed than it appeared perhaps 15 years ago. The level of "clean" was good. The decor is now a little old; there was some peeling wallpaper in the small but adequate bathroom; we noted that the bathroom shower head had separated from the wall. There were several bugs in the bathtub on arrival (easily remedied). The old taps in the tub did not work well (stiff and hard to control) and the shower head dripped for long periods even when the shower had not been touched. There was no ventilation fan in the bathroom--unless we missed the switch somehow. The most significant "negative" was the lack of satisfactory and continuing wireless receptivity in the room we occupied. A family member reported the same in the other room we occcupied, although the wireless was better at one corner of that room. The rooter and the system were both cheerfully rebooted on two occasions by the accommodating staff but to no noticeable effect. I had to re-enter the password as well many times and had frequent error messages asking for a different password. Another inconvenience was the lack (on 3 nights) of sufficiently hot water in the shower and tub. Baths were therefore not pleasant as the water quickly cooled from "barely hot," to too-cold-to-stay in the water. The tub in our room was semi-blocked and very slow--a minor issue. A function-check of all fixtures in the bathrooms would be recommended. All and all, the hotel was advertised at a good rate, and even with the above reservations, I would possibly stay again if the hot water issue could be remedied and the wireless service strengthened.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Tabihaku
Reviews.Content: This could have been a nice stay at a nice hotel in a nice location (close to UW), but it was marred by a bit of scam-flam that misrepresented the actual cost. I "Pricelined" for the room and got a fair price, but when I called to confirm the reservation I was told that it was "a single studio roomâ€”our lowest grade room" and only suitable for one person. I had "checkboxed" a two-person occupancy when bidding, so of course needed a room to accomodate two people. I was told I would have to pay $30 ($25+tax) more for a double-occupancy room. I explained I had indicated it was for two-person occupancy and never had such a problem in six years and a few dozen Priceline uses. I was told I shouldn't use Priceline (!) and that all of the hotels in Seattle did this. First, it's HOTEL DECA that decides to use Priceline, and HOTEL DECA that decides to disregard the two-person occupancy indicator and instead milk another $30 out of double occupancy even though they knew it was to be a double occupancy. It's ufortunate that an otherwise nice hotel would engage in a petty $30 scam-flam in this way; they should NOT participate in Priceline because it hurts their reputation and misrepresents the cost of a room. Note: I brought this up with the staff again on arrival at the hotel and was given the shrug/"nothing we can do" treatment. I encourage HOTEL DECA to change such unflattering and off-putting behavior and engage in in a way that better reflects their otherwise lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Random vacation turns monumental”
Reviews.Author: Moogan22
Reviews.Content: I randomly decided to take a class by Stu Stuart, comedian and beer expert from the UW at the Experimental College in Seattle. In searching for a hotel I wanted somewhere I would feel safe and cozy and clean while traveling alone. The staff was awesome. So friendly and helpful and accommodating. The hotel was clean and I loved the technology available with the i-pod doc, flat screen, and DVD player. I will stay there again if I travel that way in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: frances063
Reviews.Content: Spent 10days at the hotel. Room and service were excellent. Bathroom was small but clean. Location was near to visiting family. Location was in the Washington University area.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great place”
Reviews.Author: jake_phan
Reviews.Content: We got what I felt was a great deal on this place, especially over the Thanksgiving holiday. The location is good, but you are still a drive away from Pike Place and all the down town stuff. U District has lots to offer though. Great hotel with a cool lobby and adjacent cafe. Plenty to do within walking distance. Looking forward to staying there again. Parking in their lot is $10/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vintage Hotel Experience - Reasonable Rates - Great Location for Univ. Washington”
Reviews.Author: BonkyConk
Reviews.Content: We remarked that when the staff starts calling us by name every time we return, you've been using hotels too much ! Seriously - the staff DOES call us by name. Yes, we've stayed far too many nights in Seattle in the last year (medical issues) - but we are always pleasantly surrpised to be treated like old friends when we check in again and again. Our first stay in this hotel was with a Hotwire purchase -- but since then they've always matched those rates for us without question (unless it was a peak day and they anticipated being 100% full). This is an old hotel that has been restored. It's LOVELY Art-Deco style -- so well done, with such fine pieces of art and functional furnishings! The theme is carried through all the rooms, as well. We just enjoy walking around, enjoying the ambiance. It's quiet and clean and leisurely. * The adjoining coffee shop is great. * There's a couple of computers available for use (free), and they'll print anything you need through the network at the front desk. * Free shuttle to nearby places -- hospitals, shopping centers, restaurants, doctors, etc. Book ahead to be guaranteed you'll be there on time -- shuttle is busy and punctual. * The beds are awesome! * Sometimes we had free parking vouchers -- sometimes we had to pay for parking -- never could figure out why it was not always the same. * Close to University of WA hospitals and medical centers, and coliseum * Wonderful little restaurants everywhere -- reasonable and great food easily available. Our only problem ever experienced in all our stays was the heat in the winter. All the rooms face an outside wall (extraordinary views from every room ) - and it can be cold and windy in Seattle. The thermostats are poorly located in the room -- the heat vents runs inside the wall behind the thermostats, so when the heat blows, the thermostat picks up that warmth and shuts off. Arghh! Maintainence did their best by adding insulation behind the thermostat - but we found the only way we could resolve the problem on several below-freezing windy nights was to unscrew the thermostat from the wall and leave it dangling where it didn't pick up the duct heat. Worked perfectly then! They need to relocate all the thermostats. Maybe they've resolved the problem by now -- this was a year ago. Our daughter had some complex surgeries, and they were very accommodating while she was covered with bandages and greasy ointments, providing extra towels and linens. We could see that their hearts went out to her -- all the staff was so kind to her.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible management, nice place, but get it together Hotel Deca.”
Reviews.Author: JCR3000
Reviews.Content: Ok if your planning a wedding and thinking of staying or using any of the facilities of this hotel be weary and don't expect any cooperation from anybody at this Hotel . Previous to our stay we asked to speak to someone about catering a rehearsal dinner didn't hear back from anybody until the day before the wedding. Several of our guests did not get the discounted room that we had blocked out specifically for our guests. Actually several of our guests when making reservations contacted us because they were told that they had no records of our wedding and the the arrangements we had already made. We stayed in the penthouse which is beautiful but garbage from the previous guests was still in the room we called the front desk 3 times to have the garbage removed but they never did it. None of our guests were able to come to our room because their elevator key wouldn't work for the 16th floor. In some circumstances that would be nice but when you have numerous people from all parts of the country staying in the same hotel it would be nice if they could come to your room. The kicker of disappointment came after our wedding, we were opening a bottle of wine, it slipped and fell onto the glass counter top of the bar. You would think the bottle would break well it didn't the countertop did. My new wife cut herself on the broken glass and we called the front desk to tell them about it and they acted very non-chalant "Oh we will have our engineer look at it when he's in." OK, having broken glass all over your room is ordinary and not having anybody come look at it or even come and clean it up is that customary hotel service. Anyways nobody came to look at it, we checked out and 2 days later I notice that they had taken $1500 out of my acct for the damage without approval, without an invoice and without even contacting me. I had a great wedding and Hotel Deca is well decorated, but the people who manage that place do not know how to communicate or make guests feel very welcome. We made that hotel a lot of money by staying there and inviting all our guests to stay there, but they did nothing for us, I mean they didn't even clean the penthouse properly and they basically stole money out of my pocket. I'm still dealing with that mess 2 weeks after my wedding. Get it together Hotel Deca.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Great staff”
Reviews.Author: ChooChoo4427
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel close to U of W and within a short drive of downtown Seattle. Older building remodeled in an Art Deco style (hence the name). Decent size rooms (mine was 1212) with good views of the surrounding area. Free wireless (and wired DSL). Private parking lot adjoining the hotel -- but you have to pay for parking. I like this hotel better than the University Inn -- has a better hotel feel, more comfortable, even though the University Inn has larger rooms. Hotel Deca does have flat screen TVs, although all the channels are analog, not truly HD.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down, but still a good value”
Reviews.Author: ThisNameNotYetTaken
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Deca last Saturday night. We chose the hotel based on its location and after reading the reviews here on TA. We got a decent rate through Hotwire.com. The neighborhood was not particularly seedy (IMO), but I appreciated the security anyway (you need to have a room key to access the elevator). The hotel has lots of convenient parking, but isn't in a neighborhood I would want to wander about in after dark. As previous reviewers have noted, the place is a bit tired looking, and the bathrooms were small with no counter space to speak of. Also, it took me two tries to find a functioning ice machine. They are located on alternating floors (ours had the vending machine, but no ice), and the one on the 2nd floor wasn't working.. Beds (two double in room) were really soft, and not comfortable for sleeping with a partner as we tended to roll towards each other. I ended up in bed w/ my 5 year old, and we slept just fine. We had breakfast in the restaurant the next morning. Service was fast & friendly, food was OK. Of the three hotels we stayed out on this trip, this was our least favorite, but wasn't bad at all for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED the Hotel Deca!”
Reviews.Author: dpearl
Reviews.Content: I LOVED the Hotel Deca! I was in Seattle visiting family and stayed there for a weekend. The hotel is a charming older building that was recently renovated with a modern art deco design â€“ it was beautiful. My room was extremely clean, had an amazing view of the Space Needle and the bed was super comfortable. They also offered free Wi-Fi that worked perfectly. Not only were my accommodations enjoyable, the hotel staff were incredibly courteous and went above and beyond to assist me. For example, I left my laptop power cord at home and the front desk staff found one for me to use during my stay. I HIGHLY recommend a stay at the Hotel Deca if you are in Seattle to visit friends or family or attending a game at the University of Washington as it is centrally located in the University District.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ron-Helen
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after a cruise and found that there was an issue with the accommodation vouchers. The staff could not have been more helpful and quickly and without fuss organsied rooms for us which we were immediately given access to despite the fact it was only 0900hrs. Hotel is of a reasonable standard. We had a big room and a very comfy bed. It is about a $20 ride from the main attractions. Hotel could be doing with some refurbishment but for our purposes we certainly could not complaint and if there are better quality staff about then I have yet to find them. All staff I dealt with went out of their way to help and assist.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Wall - Thought the neighbor's shower was in our room”
Reviews.Author: ewh211
Reviews.Content: I've read a couple of reviews that mirror what I have to say. I'll start with the good. The front desk was very courteous, and for the most part helpful. The "District" restaurant has great atmosphere, the wait staff was very prompt, and the one night we ate there we had great salmon burgers with absolutely fantastic homemade fries. Now for the not so good....the room....The rooms are extremely disappointing. There is no sound proofing in the walls. At 5:00 AM, out neighbor took a shower, and it sounded like the water was right in our room. The next night we had college age kids going back and forth between rooms all night. We called the front desk, but it didn't help. The bathroom was also very disappointing. For "hip" hotel, the bathrooms are extremely outdated. They didn't even have a box of tissues in the room. Oh...the wireless internet access in the room was worthless.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: linz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. Once for their park n' cruise package which is excellent (free shuttle to cruise, complimentary breakfast, parking for duration of cruise) and another time when I was passing through. I have stayed in a small studio room and also their larger room, which was a little nicer but also more costly. Both times the rooms were very clean. The bed was large, cozy and comfortable. The free wifi connection was great. The rooms are equipped with flatscreen TVs. I enjoyed the decor as well. Although the rooms are a little pricey I realize this is in the Seattle vicinity and $100+ for a room with this hotel class is the norm. There is not much to complain about with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Deca has seen better days... I hope...”
Reviews.Author: MegDNC
Reviews.Content: Really run down. Peeling wallpaper. Paper thin walls (the complimentary ear plugs next to the bed are a good tip-off). Really not what I was expecting based on the photographs. Needs a major overhaul, or to reduce itself to a 2-star rating (and price as such). Also, I overheard management complaining about the cleaning staff, which I found tacky and unprofessional. We were charged for parking without any prior notice.

Reviews.Title: “Average, far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: mrsenano
Reviews.Content: The room that we had on the 14th floor was well appointed, and had a good although limited view of downtown seattle and the space needle. The bed was comfortable. Bathroom was a little small, the sink area didn't have much counter space. The hotel bathroom provided full size bath gel, shampoo and conditioner. Bathroom had no vent, however. My sister and her husband, on the other hand, stayed on the 4th floor with not much of a view. The ceiling had some mold in it and there were a couple cracks on the wall. She wasn't too thrilled with her room. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute drive from downtown Seattle. There is a free shuttle but only runs until 10 pm and it is first come first serve. When my family went out for a late dinner one night, the shuttle driver, who doesn't seem to know much about seattle, decided it was more convenient for him to drop us off at this area that was another 20-30 minute walk from the restaurants that were actually open. By the time we picked a restaurant and sat down and had out first course, we only had about 5 minutes to inhale our food before the last pick up tme of the shuttle. Needless to say we had to call a cab instead and pay $20 back to the hotel so we could enjoy our dinner without feeling rushed. Instead of staying there for 2 more nights, we checked out after the first night. We found a better hotel to stay in the downtown area closer to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a little pricey for the what was offered.”
Reviews.Author: dinkers77
Reviews.Content: Good place to go, not super nice, but not crappy either. We had to wait 20 minutes upon arriving to actually check in due to a backup in people checking out and housekeeping trying to keep up, but the front desk lady gave us free parking for our wait which was nice. It was also our aniversay and they gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and treats which was also very nice and courteous. The only thing I would say is that they seem overpriced. Our room did not have a microwave or a minifridge which was a bit inconvienient, yet we paid a pretty hefty price for our room, almost $200. The bathtub had a lot of peeling inside and the hot water dial was not fully functional in the tub. I've paid a lot less for the same kind of room in other areas of Seattle. But all in all, it was decent.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel and restaurant in Seattle, moderately priced”
Reviews.Author: gklipfel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca exceeded all of our expectations. We stopped there overnight, prior to an Alaskan cruise. The hotel has been recently remodeled in an older building in Seattle, and the decorator did a wonderful job. The lobby is especially beautiful, in a modern art deco style. The rooms are also artfully done, though there's not enough counter space in the bathroom. The restaurant was excellent for dinner and breakfast, one of the best we've tried in the past 30 years. Our stay included free parking while on the cruise, and a free shuttle to the cruise ship dock, all for less than $190 per night, total. We'd enthusiastically recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for proximity to U of W, but do not pay full price”
Reviews.Author: sstayner
Reviews.Content: I had a fellowship interview at the University of Seattle and asked the secretary arranging my interview to suggest a hotel. She suggested Hotel Deca. When I originally tried to book the hotel, the best on line rate I got was $173 - way too much for a hotel room for a poor medical resident. However, I did a few priceline bids the day before my check in date and scored the room for $116 w/tax. Of note, it is the only 3.5 star hotel in the "University District". Just bid low and then add other Priceline Locals with max 3 star hotels and you can get a good price. I would not pay $180 for this hotel, but for ~$100 it was very nice. No breakfast included in this price, but I bought my own.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Chris47177
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were friendly and extremely nice and helpful. The room was clean and I felt very comfortable there. They also offer a shuttle service withen a four mile radius which was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: markseigal
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have spent time at Hotel Deca. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. They went out of their way to assist us when my daughter's blanket was left behind. Very clean and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “The slanty bed brought us..... together?”
Reviews.Author: PDXbree
Reviews.Content: . We went up for the weekend from Portland to watch the Mariners play the Yankees, which I guess everyone else did too! We really wanted to stay closer to downtown but the free shuttle the hotel offered made the location doable and there was almost nothing available anywhere. Also ,there are lots of bars and eateries nearby ( plus Dicks drive-in is a few blocks away yum!) The hotel did arrange for the shuttle to pick us up from King Street Amtrak station which was great. The lobby was lovely and check in was very quick and painless. We got to our room and first glance I thought it was small, but nice. I liked the decor quite a bit and the view was actually quite good from the 10th floor - we could see the space needle! As I unpacked our things, my boyfriend sat down on the bed and it went "creeeeeaaakk creekycreekycreekycreeky creeeeeeeek" My dreams of a comfy hotel bed were shot to hell. The bed was super hard, yet bouncy at the same time. Not a great combination. We were starving and tired so we went out to grab a bite to eat - EJ's Burgers on University is FABULOUS! - and when we returned we were so exhausted we crashed out immediately. Apparently all night my boyfriend kept waking up because the slanty bed kept rolling him over to my side. He said he felt like he needed a seatbelt! I found the bed to be uncomfortable but not as much as he did. His back was really hurting him in the morning. The shower took 3-4 tries to get it running. Because of the angle of the doorway to the bathroom you had to wedge yourself behind the door in order to get it closed. I also noticed that i could hear every word the people in the next room were saying while i was in the bathroom( granted they sounded pretty drunk so they might have just been really loud people ) There was some wallpaper peeling around the room, which i guess isnâ€™t a big deal but for $140 per night I'd think they could take a piece of tape or some glue and just patch it back up. All in all the room was clean, the staff very friendly and the shuttle was a plus. For the price I expected a bit more comfort. I didn't hate it but I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with super friendly service”
Reviews.Author: GoCardinal
Reviews.Content: Everybody we encountered was downright delightful, the room was huge and comfy with a great view, we slept well, and the breakfast was very good. I'm not sure how we got such a great rate (I think it was $120 per night for the 2nd floor from the top)...perhaps because it was July and not many people were around...but we thought it was an incredible value and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: sashi60
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for several days and loved everything about the hotel. Staff was so accomodating, friendly. Michelle checked us in and gave us a room with a view of all of Seattle. Also gave us great advice on area restaurants. Room was immaculate and with nice Decor. Loved Tullys coffee shop . University is a couple of blocks away and worth exploring the entire area. We would highly recommend this hotel. Also try the organic breakfast spot a couple of blocks away, I think called Portage. You will not regret it. Thanks Deca, we loved it there. You helped make for a perfect trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: AshNHomer
Reviews.Content: First off, the parking situation was good, though not free. The neighborhood is fine. We had heard so many negative things about the shuttle that we did not try it. Instead we drove into town. We paid for the suite but it wasn't necessarily a suite. It was just bigger than a regular room. No refrigerator or microwave. The heater did not work well at all. The water pressure and water temperature were horrible. On the first morning of our stay, the housekeeper walked into our room without announcing herself at 8 AM. The room was not worth the price, though it was nicely decorated and it was convenient to have a coffee shop on the bottom (though it closed early).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Semibum
Reviews.Content: Best feature is the convenient location in the University District. The advertised remodeling of this older building really is more a redecoration but it still makes a pleasant impression. Service is friendly and accommodating. We had requested removal of all feather pillows due to an allergy and this was indeed done prior to our arrival, which most hotels seems unable to be unable to do. The hotel now has a shuttle that will take you to downtown locations of your choice. Be aware that on busy days it quickly fills and no place may be available unless you made arrangements well in advance. The rooms are comfortable although the bathroom is rather small. Note that there is no AC. In the Seattle climate this is no problem 95% of the time since the windows do open. On the rare hot day it may get uncomfortable however. There is a charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience EVER.”
Reviews.Author: Cojabri
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Hotel Deca the most beautiful place I've stayed, the staff were incredible. (Hi Wesley and Hugh!). The decor is amazing; very trendy yet warm. The room was decadent and I will definitely be a guest again.

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: tonyroder
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, superficial remodeling of public areas that are dark and uncomfortable, small room, less than 200 sqft, tiny bathroom with original 1930's fixtures, no counter space, toilet tank cover cracked and patched, cracked paint on original doors, dim bedside lamps, wobbly elevators. Alltogether a bad experience, certainly not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But Don't Rely on Their Shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: eclipse785
Reviews.Content: I surprised my wife with her first trip to Seattle and chose the Hotel Deca as a staging point. If my budget would have allowed it, I would have done something closer to the heart of Downtown Seattle, but the Hotel Deca was a good compromise. It was about a 10 minute drive (or $18 taxi fare, but I'll get to that later) to downtown Seattle. Now I'm not normally a fan of "modern" decor, but the Hotel Deca pulls it off. Their property is clean and comfortable with some rooms that offer good views of the Seattle Skyline. Our room was a corner studio with a flat screen TV, but oddly, no microwave or refrigerator. Free Wi-Fi is also available, but very weak in the location I was in. They also offer a complimentary shuttle which we decided to use the second day we were there. We had them drop us off at Pikes Place Market at 9am and the driver said, "Be sure to give us a call by 10pm if you would like a ride back". We spent the rest of the day enjoying Seattle, and even stumbling on a great little blues bar (Hwy 99 Blues). At around 9:52pm, I called the hotel for the shuttle back, but was denied simply with "I don't think we can do that for you" (verbatim). When I asked why, their response was, "Well it's getting close to 10pm" (once again, verbatim). We went back and forth with this, with both of us highlighting the fact that it WASN'T EVEN 10pm YET! The strange part about it was the fact that at no time did they ever give me a reason that they wouldn't pick me up.. just an almost robotic "I just don't think we can do that for you". The conversation ended with them telling me to get a cab. Without any other options, my wife and I got a cab back to the hotel, an $18 fare that I didn't have cash for. I almost asked the desk to reimburse me, but I didn't want to push the issue with someone who obviously didn't care. Now I don't want to detract from the hotel itself, but the way this was handled makes me question their dedication to the customer & their customer service. In fairness, this incident may not have been a reflection on the hotel, but rather a particular employee, or perhaps a policy. In any case the Hotel Deca is a very fine place to stay,.. just be careful how you use the shuttle. Now, to be fair, this could either be the result of a particular employee, The property

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel but unreliable shuttle”
Reviews.Author: tashiba
Reviews.Content: I was here for a 2 day conference with UW. The location was perfect, just a block away from University Way, where there are plenty of restaurants, shops, and interesting people watching. Tully's is adjacent to the hotel and convenient for coffee in the morning, since there is no coffee maker in the room and breakfast is not included. Rooms are nicely decorated, modern style, comfortable beds and very clean. My main gripe is that the shuttle is COMPLETELY unreliable. They make a list of who needs to go where and at what time, but they don't use the list. They booked too many people at the same time and it was a big cluster trying to get a group of about 10 people to and from our conference. They basically told everyone to just show up at a certain time but there was not enought room for everyone in the van. In addition, one lady had to wait over an hour at night, in the rain, to get picked up at the Space Needle after dinner -- when she was told the shuttle would be coming shortly. This place if fine in every respect but don't hold your breath on the shuttle. They have a parking lot where you can park your car for free - and you may want to plan on driving your own car around or catching a cab instead of relying on the shuttle. The front desk staff were young and not helpful in making restaurant recommendations - and certainly not helpful with arranging the shuttle. The District Lounge restaurant/bar in the basement of the restaurant had good food but very slow service. There was live music in The Lounge most nights. The fitness center was adequate with 2 treadmills, an elliptical, a bike, and a bench/dumbbells.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: sbyrum_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Deca and loved it. Staff was helpful, room was clean and nice. Location was great for night life and good eating. Art Deco interior was a nice touch. Coffee shop on bottom floor was very convenient. Staff was very helpful when we left an item in the lobby. They held on to it in lost and found until I called and picked it up the next day! Whew. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Location and Budget”
Reviews.Author: glve
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by this hotel because of it's distance from downtown. I recently stayed at the Hotel Deca on two separate occasions, once in December and once in January. I love the neighborhood; because of the proximity to the University there are plenty of bars and restaurants near by. You are also walking distance to a grocery store and a pharmacy. Getting downtown is very convenient, several bus stops are very close by (and Seattle's bus system is very easy to use and extremely efficient!), there are Zipcars parked in front of the hotel, and hotel's shuttle will take you to several locations as well. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel in the University District”
Reviews.Author: L15nene
Reviews.Content: We planned a 2 night trip to Seattle for my birthday and choose the Hotel Deca at the last minute.
