Having never been to Seattle we were under the impression it was close to downtown (we planned on doing all the touristy stuff, space needle, pike place market, etc.) and planned on walking to get to these hot spots. Well, it's not doable from this location. Had we done our research we would've found out this hotel is on the other side of town. However, the hotel had a complimentary shuttle that was very convenient and if the shuttle wasn't available for our desired times, the bus was just a short walk away. This hotel is super close to U of W and would be perfect for parents, or someone who is looking to visit the university. There were a ton of cute little shops within walking distance of the hotel and a good variety of places to eat. The district lounge is in the basement of the hotel and the food was great. The only con about this hotel is the walls were thin, we could hear the plumbing from rooms near to us and the vents also carried a decent amount of sound, not a huge con, but for some, it may be. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: GoodToGo541
Reviews.Content: Hotel Deca is easy to find from I-5. Checking in was easy enough and the staff were helpful and forthcoming with information. Our room was a junior suite that faced west toward the Olympic Mountains. It wasn't really a suite in the true sense but a large room with an adequate bathroom. We lucked out with the weather. Sunny, crisp temperatures with splendid sunsets visible from our room. The internet worked fine, some slight noise from our neighbor's tv but not enough to be a bother, shuttle worked out well for us, the parking is free, and the staff was wonderful. I do have an issue with the shower water temperature varying when used elsewhere. Someone could get scalded if you don't realize how to accomodate for it. We were told that improvements are in the near future. Didn't see anything sleazy about the neighborhood. Lots of little hole in the wall restaurants with great food, good portions and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, dirty floors, dicey neighborhood at night.”
Reviews.Author: chefivy
Reviews.Content: I was woken by people talking while waiting for the elevator and could hear person next door move their shower curtain! Bathroom smelled like a wet sweatsock after I showered. And then, I stepped on what I hope to god was a crumbled chocolate cookie left by a previous occupant near the base of the bed. Gross. The neighborhood by day is fine, but at night, its scary. I stepped out for a bite and saw a guy cleaning his crack pipe and got offered drugs twice, all within 2 blocks of the hotel. The lobby looks cool, but don't read a book by the cover.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected. In a bad way.”
Reviews.Author: Ash510
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sure that my trip to the Deca was the exception not the rule (at least I'm hoping.) Getting there we weren't offered any help with our bags, which wouldn't be a big deal if we didn't have suitcases and duffel bags that we had to maneuver down a ramp and then up to our hotel room. Front Desk Staff was friendly, but not knowledgeable about local sites or places to eat. We pretty much had to rely on Yelp for that. The room LOOKED nice. But the bathroom sink didn't work properly, and when looked closer, there were dead bugs and paint chips scattered next to the window. And when I moved a chair to sit closer to the desk, I found a pair of DIRTY UNDERWEAR (obviously not mine nor my boyfriend's.) The maid took at least 15 minutes to get up to our room to pick them up. The front desk sent up a bottle of wine and continental breakfast vouchers as apology for the room, but I honestly would have preferred being moved to a different (clean) room. I wish I could say I recommend this hotel, but I don't. While staff was friendly, they were not helpful and while the room was lovely, it was unclean.

Reviews.Title: “near the campus”
Reviews.Author: costaricagregg
Reviews.Content: This is one of a few hotels near U of Wash. in Seattle University district. Stayed here because of the location- 5 blocks from campus and got the upgrade to the Sky Level suite. Well, it isn't a suite and the room's a little funky, but still a good place. I particularly like the art deco theme and some of the decorations are neat. Would stay here again, but only cause I want to be near the campus. Check out the District Lounge if you want to hear some jazz- guitars both nites I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pisco47
Reviews.Content: After a summer of traveling around the world from Bangkok to Bali to Buenos Aires and staying in all sorts of hotels I would rate the Deca very near to the top- We got a great deal on the room and couldn't have been happier. Everything about the hotel was super Would recommend this place and would surely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Lilacs75
Reviews.Content: The lobby is chic and the rooms are a mixture of classic and modern. Somehow it works to make a pleasant hotel that makes you feel like it is 2010 and 1930 at the same time. Some of the rooms are very small for two people. The upper floors in general have excellent views. The hotel restaurant and bar is great. Only complaints are that the wireless is flaky, the parking is overpriced for the neighborhood, and the neighborhood can be loud. Nevertheless, I can recommend the hotel for this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: kbauman101
Reviews.Content: Although I booked with Priceline (at a very nice price), I was upgraded to a larger room since one was available - thanks to the very cordial staff. The room had a mild old hotel smell - well, it IS an old hotel that has been nicely redone in an interesting decor. There are great local dining/eating places in a university streetlife setting. Take the Metro bus from the airport for $1.75 and walk 2 short blocks to the hotel or the Shuttle Express van for $19.00. The hotel shuttle picked me up at my conference location and brought me back to the hotel gratis! The main thing was that the room was spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable with crisp bedding. The staff was very welcoming and the decor harkened to 1940's in a lovely way.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gmilliken
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the very best people working for them, so friendly and kind with a big dash of helpful. They made me feel so welcome. I was their guest for 3 weeks in September and was so spoiled. In October I again had the privilage of staying there and they even remembered me by name. The hotel is very clean and the beds are comfortable. The view of course is spectacular. Shuttle service was fantastic as wellâ€¦ In fact I didn't rent a car because they were so flexibleâ€¦.Go ahead and stay here so they can spoil you as well..You won't regret it..................

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: gktmd2
Reviews.Content: Received this hotel on a priceline bid. It is convienent to the U. Checin was quick and the employees friendly and helpful. The room was nice but the bathrooms are small. It is an old hotel that has been remodeled nicely and has an art deco theme. There is free wireless. The workout room is a joke. The breakfast in the basement restaurant was just OK but it may have been what I ordered. The beds are comfortable. Rooms on the upper levels have great views of the sound, the U, space needle, etc. My son tells me opposing teams stay here when they are in town. All-in-all it is a nice, mid-range hotel and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “BEEEEYOUTIFUL!”
Reviews.Author: DanNell
Reviews.Content: Quaint, stylish, nifty and different. The staff was lovely, the little coffee shop attached to the lobby was convenient and delicious. We were confused about the parking situation but it all worked out and it was great to be near stores and such that we could walk to, like Half Price Books!! ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle Hotel & Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: katie334
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Deca because we were dropping off my little sis at college. I would have to say that it is one of the best Seattle hotels around. This hotel was in a great location and even though it was a little more expensive then usual hotels, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Polished on the outside, but. . .”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerat40
Reviews.Content: I would reccomend this hotel with some reservations. It was stylish, had some of the necessarys like internet, etc. and the beds were super comfy. HOWEVER, it was fairly far from where I wanted to sightsee. If visitng the University only it would be perfect but everywhere else is a hike. The staff was friendly enough but not particularly helpful in addressing two concerns I had. I heard there was a free shuttle from a friend that lives in Seattle not from the staff. Next time I visit, I will pay more for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, customer-friendly, convenient choice for UW visitors”
Reviews.Author: MissAnthropic
Reviews.Content: I travel semi-frequently to Seattle (3 to 5 times a year) to visit friends and my daughter, who attends the University of Washington. I usually stay at the University Inn, a sort of plain-vanilla hotel near campus with nice amenities, a great staff and spacious rooms. This last trip they were booked and the only near-campus option I had was the Hotel Deca. I booked myself a room and then looked at the trip advisor reviews here, prior to my flight. I was alarmed by some of the negative ones but I discovered they were unfounded. No hotel is perfect, but Hotel Deca is a solid choice for travelers interested in staying in or near the University District. PROS: 1. The bed - the mattress and pillows on my king-sized bed were unusually comfortable, and I'm a picky traveler. In fact, I had a better night's sleep at Deca than I've had at many five-star spa hotels. 2. Other room amenities I enjoyed: Flat screen TV, windows that actually open for fresh air (be alert, if traveling with little children) free wireless internet. 3. The food in the basement-level restaurant, which is also the room-service kitchen, is surprisingly great. I ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was really upscale, fresh and delicious. Room service was prompt, also excellent, and not as costly as it could have been. 4. Staff - Every single employee I came into contact with was friendly, warm and helpful. 5, Location - Right on 45th and Brooklyn Ave - a great intersection with pedestrian traffic, shops, bus lines, etc. This is a bustling, student-oriented little pocket of Seattle. The guests in the hotel were divided between business travelers, academic visitors and families of students coming to UW for the new semester. Oh, and for what it's worth, a few other guests at the hotel were cast members from "The Real Housewives of Orange County." Ha - that's either a plus or a minus, depending on your tastes... 6. Free use of the desktop computers and printer in the lobby. - I didn't bring my laptop and made use of both. 7. Free shuttle rides - wherever I wanted to go. CONS 1. Bathrooms are smallish.

Reviews.Title: “Decorated with cheap art, drug dealers on front steps”
Reviews.Author: gomez71
Reviews.Content: Hotel is trying to be "artsy" but instead is decorated cheaply . We smelled pot coming through the AC vents. The staff was very nice and friendly , but the location of the hotel and the patrons are less than appealing. Everytime I walked outside my room I felt like I was surrounded by thugs and gangstas.

Reviews.Title: “A little deep cleaning would help!”
Reviews.Author: Anguilla-7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a very helpful reservation department--very courteous--only problem when we arrived at the hotel for a 10 day stay (medical treatment) the suite we were promised was NOT available! We were given a room and they moved us the next afternoon. The room was spacious but never up to hotel standards for cleanliness I didn't think. Coffee shop: In the area known for its great coffee--Tullys didn't make the grade! Next trip I'll return to the University Inn--very accommodating and CLEAN!

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant experience for UW visitors”
Reviews.Author: jess2216
Reviews.Content: Only stayed two nights as in transit to cruise. Found the hotel clean and welcoming with decent breakfast on offer. Shuttle was helpful for getting into Seattle downtown as is a little isolated from the trouristy areas. Very good if wanting to be near the university.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent local shuttle, free wireless, down bedding, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: zippy47
Reviews.Content: A renovated older property, some of the Deca's rooms are surprisingly tiny: mine had a long double bed, narrower than a queen, and one side of it was up against a wall. On the other hand, the duvet was down, the pillows were excellent, and I was very comfortable. The closet was a walk-in, so at least I wasn't sharing the meager space with my luggage. The hotel offers a first-come-first-served shuttle in the local area, which I found to be very useful. Make your reservations early. Free wireless net (yay!). The gym was tiny, but it had modern cardio machines and a good collection of free weights. My biggest complaint, aside from the space, was the difficulty finding power outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and modern look”
Reviews.Author: pasherlo
Reviews.Content: Unassuming from the outside, the modern interior matched well with the skyline views from our window. $8 parking and convenient location near UW were nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Different. Windows dangerous for small infants.”
Reviews.Author: shakakan
Reviews.Content: So our stay at "the deca" was great for the value (we booked through priceline and bid $90.00) I definitely don't think it is worth the full value $200.00/night rate. Parking is NOT FREE. Internet IS free. Rooms are nicely appointed with a funky modern art deco design. Beds are very comfortable. Bathrooms are tiny tiny tiny, with old stained tubs, but are cute in their own right with a pedestal sink. So the outlet issue. It is an issue if you want to plug your computer in on the computer desk or plug anything in for that matter. There are 2 accessible outlets in the entire room. The other extention cord is behind the TV stack and is fully loaded as a result of the lacking receptacles. This hotel was built in the 30's and unfortunately when they updated it, they didn't work on the electricity issue. The only other issue are the windows. Small infants could fall out the windows. They don't have safety locks either. THIS IS DEFINITELY A PROBLEM.

Reviews.Title: “nice location and rate”
Reviews.Author: siucarnpb
Reviews.Content: enjoyed my stay, easy to get to dtn seattle and the cost was just right and parking was free and felt secure as I had items I had to leave in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, close to Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: Driftwood3212
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Deca, although the Hotel was not located directly in Downtown Seattle, we were still close enough to the city that it was only a 10-15 minute drive down to the Seattle water front. The hotel staff was very personable and friendly and the rooms were very clean and decorated nicely. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2064
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline, and it was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Full size bed for 2, a bathroom so small I had barely enough space to close the door, a bed so uncomfortable, I woke up in the middle of the night with a backache, and walls so thin I could hear the people next door going to the bathroom... I usually book my hotels through Priceline and I had never been disappointed until I stayed at Hotel Deca. I requested a king size bed (instead of 2 queens) and instead, they gave me one full! I don't know any other hotels with full size beds...and they call themselves a 31/2 star hotel? I stayed at a 3 star hotel by the airport which was MUCH better than this one. Needless to say...I don't recommend this hotel. You can find much better deals elsewhere in Seattle. If you have a car, I would recommend staying by the airport. Bigger rooms, better quality beds, for much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls for your ears, the smell of urine for your nose, but it looks nice.”
Reviews.Author: gregtead
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 5th floor in room 512. We were at the mercy of the sounds from the elevator, and because the walls are thin those sounds dominated our time there. In addition to that the smell of urine (from a previous guest) seemed to grow more pungent over the course of our noisy overnight. This is a glorified party hotel, and the staff is too young to treat it like anything more than a crappy job. On a positive note the rooms do look nice, and if you get a room facing southwest you'll enjoy a great view of the city and Mt. Rainier.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem just a few minutes to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Magarnacle
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business and was very impressed. The staff was great and very helpful. The food was above average and very good for a hotel. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. The size of the rooms surprised me for a boutique hotel. I would certainly stay here again for business. Free high speed throughout the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “an absolutely wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: caddynotlikegolf
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest. We made our reservations on Priceline and I was somewhat anxious about this hotel. As someone with a strong design background I was both enthused and put off by the online photos. Would Hotel Deca be a style over substance kind of place? Would the service be snooty and the bed beautiful, yet uncomfortable? Lucky for us, none of the preceding proved true. Hotel Deca is beautiful and a wonderful find. We stayed on the 8th floor and I can attest to the great view of the space needle! Our room was spacious: there were three of us (hubby, me, and our toddler) and we were comfortable. There also were plenty of outlets around with which to charge our electronics. The room featured a comfortable sitting area with two armchairs, a nice big fully-stocked desk, plasma tv with DVD, iHome alarm clock, and comfy down comforter. Also, I am what some would call a "germaphobe" and found the room to be exceedingly clean. I've stayed at 5 star hotels and this hotel lacks some of the frills you may get at one of them. But, it gets pretty darn close.

Reviews.Title: “Free wifi but no electrical outlets -- a hotel of contradictions”
Reviews.Author: tigerb
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca is lovely, and we liked its location in the University District near many ethnic restaurants. But the hotel was full of contradictions. 1. The hotel has screaming fast WiFi... but our room had no outlets for charging our laptop. Lamp wires went under the baseboards. We found one lamp plugged into an extension cord (hello! They are not for constant use!) and used that. 2. The hotel has beautifully designed chairs and Art Deco decor everywhere... but I sat on exactly ONE chair all weekend that was even comfortable. 3. The hotel shuttle exists... but to do what? We needed a shuttle to the Victoria Clipper dock, and the Clipper runs once a day in the winter. They said they could take us -- but the shuttle doesn't start early enough to do so. 4. We asked for more towels. The housekeeper came while we were gone -- and got out extra linens for the bed. Huh? 5. We had a catered event at the hotel and the hotel was given a head count in advance of how many guests would be there. They ran out of food. 6. The Deco bathroom had a pedestal sink -- which means there's no place to set down all your toiletries! So, I don't know what to tell you. Go to the Deca with a powerful laptop battery, don't sit down, bring your own car and towels and snacks? It was lovely and convenient... mostly.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but nice”
Reviews.Author: AntigenBand
Reviews.Content: Room: Truthfully said, the rooms look better in the pictures than they do in real life. That being said, they're still nice rooms, tastefully decorated. Very comfy bed and pillows. Had a beautiful view out the window on the 15th floor, with a nice sofa to relax and read on in front of the window under the sun. Cons: The walls are really thin, i could hear people talking in the other rooms very easily. Also, there is no mini-fridge in the room, which is bad for me since I like to buy fruits and cheese to munch on during trips. Location: The good thing about the location is that it's in the university district, meaning there's plenty of restaurants and bars all around. The bad thing is that it's in the university district, meaning it is definitely not within walking distance to downtown and the waterfront. That being said, a bus ride to downtown takes about 15-20 mins. Bottom line: Definitely a nice hotel, but I find it a bit pricey given the problems above.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: syser
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Great facilities with pretty deluxe rooms--the bed in our room was very very comfy. The service was excellent and cordial and the location is perfect for access to all of Seattle's neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Trying for the Kimpton look but not cutting it”
Reviews.Author: BulldogMatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel has excellent service. This is the best part of the hotel. Each person encountered was pleasant and helpful. We were given a 4 pm late check out on New years day, which was unexpected and very nice. The problems are with the rooms. We paid $159 for a Junior Suite. Not horribly expensive, not horribly cheap. I would argue that the room we had was a Junior Suite. A small bay in the windows accounted for the "Junior." The bed was comfortable but the furnishings which appeared to be somewhat new seemed cheap and uninspiring. The hotel is in the University District. This was clearly advertised. I guess I was expecting some charm and quaintness but it was more seedy and downtrodden, than I expected. On our next trip to Seattle, we would select another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, terrible”
Reviews.Author: travelingmodel
Reviews.Content: For the price I really expected so much more (I stayed in one of their suites). Their photos on line looked way nicer then the actual room. The walls where PAPER thin. I could hear the person in the next room taking a bath (at 6am) and the sound was amplified and echoed through my room. I payed the extra 10 bucks for their business package. I was still charged for parking (they took it off eventually, but I had to ask them twice). Even though my checkout time was 4pm (part of their business package) the maid service knocked on my door 3 times! (I should mention, I had a do not disturb sticker on my door) Then, the maid service actually called my room to find out what time I was leaving. I have NEVER had that happen before, late check out or not. Lastly, I was locked out of the elevator twice and had to go to the front desk to get back in to my room. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My new Seattle Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xntric
Reviews.Content: After a surprisingly low rate from Priceline, I was skeptical, but the deal was sealed and the price too low to say no to. I live just outside the city, but I stay "in the city" about once a month, and will probably stay here 90% of the time from now on. The outside is nothing to write home about, but enter the lobby and you're in a lovely boutique hotel. I just don't have anything bad to say, from the amazingly kind and attentive staff to the cool decor, to the view. FREE PARKING is the cherry on top. I am sick of $35 a night piracy at the big downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Definite YES!”
Reviews.Author: Chrystianne
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, the Deca is a wonderful place to stay, especially if visiting a son/daughter going to the University of Washington or overnite when enjoying a Husky game (the stadium is within walking distance). The color scheme throughout is upbeat, modern and inviting. The elevator walls are plush navy velvet and the hallway wallpaper and carpeting are extremely appealing. The rooms are very comfortable as well as the beds and pillows. We stayed on the 15th floor with a gorgeous view of downtown Seattle and the Space Needle. Also, they offer 2 free-of-charge computers in the lobby and free Wi-Fi if you bring your own. Remember, if you have a UW alumni assoc. card, ask for your "Dawg" discount. We saved $29 and parking was free. FYI-just north of the hotel on Saturdays is the local Farmers Market at Brooklyn & 50th.

Reviews.Title: “a fine stay”
Reviews.Author: jane_birkin
Reviews.Content: Perfectly nice hotel in the U District, very convenient to downtown as well. It was clean and safe. Nicely designed, not too swanky and not too motel-ly looking. WiFi was pretty weak but I bring my own anyway, so it didn't matter. The room was a bit chilly, but I turned the heat on and it was fine. The staff were nice and helpful. I hadn't thought to ask that the bed have a blanket on it--seems kinda standard, right-- but when i asked for a blanket that wasn't made of down, they didn't have any, so they gave me a pile of sheets. the bed was quite comfortable and I slept like a log. No more free breakfast, but there's a Tully's Coffee in the hotel where you can get a coffee that's probably better than what their free coffee would be. Tons of places to eat nearby-- you're in the best part of Seattle for ethnic cheap eats.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, awesome prices”
Reviews.Author: woodspinner
Reviews.Content: Well I read earlier comments which may have been during or before rehab. The facility is dated on the outside. They offer different "packages" including free parking and even gas card. I negotiated a significant discount off the rack rate by talking to them direct. Also got free parking and a $100 gas card for a 3 night stay. The interior is exactly like pictured on the website. Staff friendly and helpful. Size of room is a subjective thing. We had two queen bed, a sitting area with two upholstered chairs and a table, a desk and chair and the plasma screen sat on a long wooden piece of furniture. I certainly felt the room was large. The decor of the room was exactly like the pictures of the rooms on the website. I will certainly be a return guest due to all mentioned above as well as it's proximity to downtown Seattle, ease of getting there and very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: AbbieIdaho
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Deca for three days in September. It is a very neat Hotel with great beds, nice employees and an overall good vibe. We utilized the free shuttle and went to Pike's Market and other downtown locations. This saved a ton of money on cab fare but please remember to schedule the shuttle early and tip the driver. Find a different place to have breakfast (like Costas) two blocks away but do have a cocktail at the District Lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tripsabound
Reviews.Content: In the past, this hotel has offered free parking and free continental breakfast (all of the other local university hotels offer this) but not currently. The staff did not seem to know about the basic amenities of the hotel, and our room was very small. I would expect much better from a boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: lovelola
Reviews.Content: after seeing pictures of the hotel and its new renovations i was expecting more than what was actually there. but overall i cant complain its a pretty good location, no problems with staff, and respectably clean . if your planning a long term visit i would probably advice somewhere else but for a quick trip hotel deca was perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “No issues with Hotel Deca...”
Reviews.Author: BumbleBeeTuna
Reviews.Content: I must say I was a bit apprehensive after reading the posts here, but I can happily report our recent stay at Hotel Deca was very good. We are a family of 4, with one 3 yr old toddler and a 6 week old newborn. The hotel room was large enough for us, although the bathroom was tight. The room was clean and the hotel staff were great, contrary to some posts reported here. I know experiences can vary from person to person, but I have no issues with this hotel. $6 parking at the hotel was a good deal as well. This hotel is well-located within minutes of downtown and the Woodland Park Zoo (our primary destination). Our PL bargain at $60 a night also helped.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to UW”
Reviews.Author: Highboltage
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried that it looked very trendy and boutique like from the website pictures so I wondered if it would live up to its images. It did. I was first greeted by Eric (aka Charlie) the bellman. He was extremely helpful and friendly. It was from him that I found out that the hotel had a free shuttle for locations approx. 5 miles from the hotel. The decor was eclectic to say the least but it worked. A fire in the fireplace was a nice touch, except Seattle was experiencing a heat wave at the time. The elevators aren't huge but they work, interesting treatment with the decor, faux leather around the grab bars, a mirror and blue cut velvet. My room was on the 7th floor and had a great view out of the bay style window. I could see portions of downtown and the space needle. The room was clean with a European feel, especially the duvet on the bed and variety of pillows. The in room decor was nice too. The room was quiet enough, I could hear the neighbors water running if I was in the bathroom but there was nothing that disturbed my sleep. There was a large flat screen t.v. and also a dvd player. I did not try the internet connection so I can't report on that. The hotel is in the University area so it is a fairly easy walk to campus. The area around it is okay, a bit grungy but nothing out of the ordinary for an urban academic area. It is also close to the water and some really nice walking/riding trails. I was staying at a conference rate, so I don't know what the regular rate is but it was worth what I ended up paying. Enjoy your stay if you go. (BTW - I took the hotel shuttle downtown to the Westin and was able to walk down to Pike Place Market and the Space Needle.)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable location with a view of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MaryBWashingtonDCUSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Deca is located close to the University of Washington and near Lake Union. It offers a free shuttle to other parts of Seattle and from the airport. Rooms are comfortable. The night we were there the pianist in the very pleasant downstairs lounge was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but pretty darn good”
Reviews.Author: hollyandwally
Reviews.Content: Just left Seattle and wanted to give Deca a plug for being so nice to our family. There were a few little things that could improve, but the service was top notch. Pros: 1) Friendly, accomodating staff. Service with a smile & a sincere desire to please. 2) Lobby is a great place to gather to plan your day. In some hotels you feel really self-concious sitting in the lobby, but here you feel completely at ease. 3)The free shuttle made it really easy to get downtown. The first day we took the car downtown and had to pay $18 to park - this was a great alternative. 4) Spacious room. We were in 1507 which had two queen beds and still enough room for 3 chairs, a desk, and a tv stand. It was comfortable for our family of 4. 5) Views, views, views! Nice view of downtown, the Space Needle, and the mountains. This was a big hit with the kids. 6) Price. The hotel was about $40 lower than the same level of hotels we considered downtown. We used the money we saved to go on a seaplane ride - a better investment if you have kids! Cons: 1) Bathroom is small. If i was traveling by myself i wouldn't mind, but with a family it took a lot of time to get everyone ready. 2) The room has a DVD player but they don't have any DVD's to loan you. They should have a library if they are going to have a player, 3) They don't have a kids menu. All in all the restaurant didn't cater to kids very well. We didn't see many other kids during our stay, but still... 4) could be more "green". There was an option to not change your sheets, but no recyle bins, the tempature control was old and only turned on and off which keeps the AC running even when you aren't there, & the fireplace in the lobby is on all the time burning gas. All in all we would stay again. The nice staff, beautiful decor, & good value made up for the "cons'.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Deca”
Reviews.Author: Lacemaker
Reviews.Content: great experience for our first trip to Seattle, along with our children aged 11 and 6. Incredibly helpful young staff (most are students trying to earn money). Free courtesy car to the zoo, downtown and a shopping mall. Great tips of where to eat and shops to visit, provided by the staff. Our room suffered a burst pipe after two nights stay and we were immediately upgraded to a bigger room with lots of apologies. Great places to eat nearby and although out of town we liked that feeling of staying in a real neighbourhood. Very good value for money and frankly we don't go to hotels to spend all day there, we want to spend it out in the city. Ideally a hotel should provide a clean and comfy place to stay, where the staff are helpful and the location suits your needs and the price suits your budget. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: andy75
Reviews.Content: I booked based on the rave reviews on the site, and was sorely disappointed. We were in Seattle for graduation weekend, and the hotel conveniently jacked its rates way up. This was in no way good value for money. The hotel is 2-star at best. Whoever says it is 5-star based on their world travels must be kidding. The place is shabby, the rooms are small, the bathrooms are at least 20 years old, and it feels like a bad Hampton Inn, remodeled out of a "fake boutique hotel" catalogue. This is not a pleasant, boutique hotel. It is a run-down pit taking advantage of people who are looking for a boutique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience at the Deca”
Reviews.Author: littleKay08
Reviews.Content: Totally a mediocre, 2 star place. I'm surprised by many of the reviews here. Got a deal on the Deca, and looked up ratings online. Most places rate this 4 to 4.5 stars. Deca is an old hotel that's been remodeled. We ended up seeing 2 rooms, the first being close to the elevator with water damage on the ceiling. The bed in that room was very hard. We moved to another room. Wallpaper was peeling in some spots. Water damage on the ceiling here. The worst? The bathtub did not drain and we stood calf high in water while we showered. I think some people get dazzled by the "new" and "hip" decorations of the lobby, multiple pillows on the bed and the flat screen TV in the room. Honestly, this is a 2 or 3 star experience at best. If you want to stay some place nice, try Inn at the Market, the Sheraton or one of the Kimpton group hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Clever Accommodations Convenient to U District and Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TallTexan83
Reviews.Content: My colleague told me that staying at the Hotel Deca would be a treat, but I was not prepared for what I encountered. I fell in love with the "boutique" concept of intimate, unique accommodations while traveling frequently for business to San Francisco a few years ago. I did not expect to find anything remotely similar in Seattle, but the Hotel Deca proved me wrong. The clever "Art Deco meets Michael Graves" style lobby was both stunning and cozy and our beautifully appointed room followed suit. Unlike many other boutique hotels I have frequented, the meticulously styled room was quite large and the king-sized bed was a delight. Throughout our stay, the staff was professional, friendly and, I might add, as elegant as the property itself. The hotelâ€™s U District location proved to be perfect for my business needs at the University of Washington while my wife had quick and easy access to Seattleâ€™s downtown and Lake Union tourist destinations. We both decided that the next time Seattle is in our itinerary for whatever reason, we will be staying at the Deca.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room condition/dirty rooms and baths”
Reviews.Author: bundlebr
Reviews.Content: Still in the hotel, only because booked two nights prepaid. While the front desk and bell service are good, housekeeping is extremely bad. The bathroom is dirty with hairs left on walls, nobody really cleaned bathroom before and during my stay. The carpet in the room was not clean and wasn't cleaned/vacuumed during our stay (same bread crumbles stayed untouched). Towels look to be used for ages having some yellowish stains. The bathroom feels and smells rather like a public restroom rather than "luxury hotel" bathroom! General feeling was that the room was not cleaned for us when we came in, but rather got 5-minute touch-up to look OK. All amenities and gadgets that they put in the room don't make it looking bad, but rather odd. Couple years ago we stayed in a small 30-buck motel in Southern California - that one was really clean comparing to this dirty monster. Really - my WORST hotel experience in many years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Harpermom
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were excellent! Friendly and extremely helpful, even with the smallest details. Transportation was great, and the rooms were decorated so fun and comfortable. Loved the ipod station!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fayesuave
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an artsy feel to it and is located in the middle of the University District. So, if you are looking to visit this area, the hotel is a great location. It also too minutes to drive downtown and to the Pike Market. The rooms are clean enough and colourfully decorated. The price was good (I paid about $100US for a night for 2 people). The hotel also provided free high speed internet service on public computers downstairs and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great property”
Reviews.Author: R.ching
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Deca April 3 for two nights. We had stayed at the same property several years ago when I believe it was known as University Tower. The years have been kind to the hotel as the new owner has done a very nice job of remodeling. Although it is an old hotel it still has a nice feel to it and because it is an old hotel, there are concrete walls between units making noise from other units practically non-existent. Plus free parking! The staff- front desk, maids, maintenance, drivers were all consistently courteous, friendly and professional in their duties. We had a problem with our TV, within 1 hour the maintenance guys came in to try and trouble shoot- and then replace the set. The front desk gave great recommendations and directions. If you are visiting the University area this location cannot be beat. easy walking distance to UW. Great restaurants in the Wallingford area, 10 minute drive from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Deca --terrible disappointment”
Reviews.Author: avocats
Reviews.Content: Figured this "hip" hotel would have a decent internet connection to allow me to work; wrong. Worse than dial-up, and the management denied there was a problem and would not provide any assistance. Lobby "access" just as bad. I would not stay here if you have any hope of conducting business.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johosephat
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay at the Hotel Deca in Seattle. Good for business travel-- comfortable chair with desk, helpful staff that was knowledgeable about the Seattle area. I was there for a conference. Had a nice room on one of the top floors in the corner of the building. There are good views available like this one, so I recommend asking about it. There is a downstairs bar/restaurant. Small TVs, though. So if, for example, you are trying to watch the Red Sox in game 2 of the World Series, you should go somewhere else. :-) Swanky lobby with a fireplace (can't remember if real fire) is a good place to lounge around and meet up with a friend. In the University district. Plenty of good food nearby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and plan to return”
Reviews.Author: Jruss_in_PA
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay here. I chose one of their smaller rooms for the price. I loved the tasteful modern decor and the room felt very cozy. The rate included wireless acess, free and easy parking and complimentary b'fast. ( I thought the b'fast was ok, but preferred to get my coffee in the starbucks-like coffee shop right there in the same building. ) My only problem was the heat vent was near the ceiling so upper half of the room was quite a bit warmer than the lower half. Since I was there in Oct/Nov. it was a little cool. Still, I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcFly
Reviews.Content: Nice, stylish hotel in the centre of University district. About 20 minutes from Downtown in a cab Good sized rooms with large TVs Decent restaurant and bar on site Not a whole lot to do around the hotel, so count on having to travel around

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MCT672
Reviews.Content: For the rate this was a great value. We were visiting family for Thanksgiving in Seattle and we picked it because the location was convenient to my family's house. We were surprised when we checked in to find a very chic lobby, large rooms that have been recently renovated. It very much had a feel of a chic boutique hotel. The free continental breakfast was more like the Hampton Inn - but it was free. Also it was in a convenient location with lots of reasonably priced restaurants as a result of being near a university and easy freeway (I-5) access to the rest of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Deca is a delight!”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyONE
Reviews.Content: Props to Priceline for turning me onto this great boutique hotel. I got a great rate on a wonderful hotel in a nice location. I reserved a room with a king, but when I checked in they didn't have one available. As a result, I was upgraded to a suite with two queen beds. It was a great room and I have zero complaints. Staff is very friendly and quick to respond to any requests; I forgot a toothbrush (doh!) and one was brought to me within minutes. Parking, internet access and breakfast are complimentary. The wifi connection is available throughout the hotel, which makes sitting in front of the fireplace in their gorgeous lobby to catch up on work a nice option.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: miss_kat_lover
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews (the good ones and the bad), we decided to stay at the hotel because it's relatively cheap for a 3 stars hotel (around $100 per night on Priceline). Yes, the room is quite small but it is very clean and has all the amenties (big LCD TV, alarm clock radio where you can plug in your iPod, Dvd, comfy bed). The style of the hotel is elegant and I find quite tasteful. While it is not in the heart of Seattle, they do provide a free drop off/pickup shuttle service (which ends at 10PM at night) to the Westin in Downtown. The free breakfast I find was pretty good... bagels, fruit, yogurt, bread, cereal, tea/coffee, etc. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: enjayflyer
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel in the University district area. The room I stayed in had a king-sized bed, an I-Home for my Ipod and a flat screen TV! While the room was on the small side -it was very cozy and most of all - clean! There is an amazing complimentary continental breakfast in the morning and while I only stayed for one night, the staff was accomodating and friendly! FYI, taxi cabs are very expensive. From the airport, $55.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting renovation, improve room service!”
Reviews.Author: cooperllc
Reviews.Content: This is a nice re-make of a dowdy old building, although even cosmetics couldn't change the thin walls, teeny bathroom, and oddly-shaped room in which I had to lie perpendicular on the bed to watch TV and practically had to lean out the window to see myself in the full-size mirror. Still, a great bed, nice amenities, good sheets. Excellent service at the front desk and speedy room service....but that's where they lost me. I ordered a steak and salad and expected a basic tray at the door. What arrived instead (although in record time) was a plastic bag with cardboard takeout boxes and plastic cutlery. It's not easy to cut a nearly raw piece of meat inside a paper box with plastic cutlery. Considering the $42 I paid for that meal it was pretty sady, actually.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice and safe...whatelse you want in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilson_angs2002
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel periodically since 2004. It has always been my first choice when I travel to Seattle for my official trip. Helpful staff, free wifi, have one of the most coolest lobby i seen in the northeast. They even have a fire place in the lobby. The rooms are comfortable, clean and most important safe. What else you want for a hotel.... Maybe the only improvement that they need to inprove is the breakfast. Should cater more varity to suit different taste.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the area”
Reviews.Author: calvino
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in the University of Washington area. The other hotels (Silver Cloud, University) are not much, and only a little less $$ than the Deca. The Deca has some class. Clearly this is an old building that has been refurbished, and at least on my floor and in my room, this refurbishment was done well. I think that if I go again I'll stay in Bellevue and drive, rather than going for the local option. But if you want to be within walking distance to the campus, I'll recommend the Deca.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate experience??”
Reviews.Author: Gwelly
Reviews.Content: Was recommended by a hotelier to stay at the Deca but our experience was not what it should have been. We booked (family of 4) directly with the hotel in Feb 2007 for 3 nights in August. I called in July 2007 to make sure the booking was still good. They had no booking. Re-booked. Before our departure I noticed that my bank account was down two night stay for some dates in July. I called the hotel and discovered they had accidentally charged my credit card for someboby elses stay!! All was refunded - even the currency difference after we complained. Hotel rooms and lobby are lovely. The walk to the breakfast room is just shabby. More could be done to improve the breakfast. The lifts are a very, very, very slow - mostly occupied by the chambermaids. Other guests also agreed. Front desk staff have no knowledge of the area (restaurants etc.) and admitted so. Have to say I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility but the staff is...”
Reviews.Author: IowaGirl52
Reviews.Content: ... incompetent at best. The rooms are fine (nicely decorated and very clean -- housekeeping does a great job. Comfy bed and pillows too) although the wireless is pretty flakey (and don't bother to ask the staff for assistance -- they either don't have a clue or just don't care). The BIG problem with this hotel is the incompetence of the staff. I do give them props for being insanely cheerful (to the point of being annoying) while they tell you "it" really isn't their problem, "it" is your (the guest) fault and to "have a good one!" Ack. Granted, the average age of the front desk staff appears to be about 23 (and they all have great gum-chewing skills!), so perhaps things will improve as they mature a bit. But until then, I am staying at the new, lovely hotel a few block away. If you do stay here, make sure you get EVERYTHING in writing before you check in. And just beware that customer service is no where on their list of priorities. (In a way, I guess it IS "my fault" because I had expected to be treated with honesty, courtesy and respect -- silly me! :)

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: jetfly
Reviews.Content: Front Desk were all young woman I guessed they worked here part time and were college students. When checking in I felt like I was imposing and they were doing me a favor. After the cold reception I went to my room and though nicely decorated and clean was too small I couldn't walk around the bed without tripping. Don't stay here I would go as far as paying less for a 2 star than stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished”
Reviews.Author: stayklassy
Reviews.Content: The art deco overhaul of this hotel was nicely done. The outside of the building is still quite blah (but they are apparently working on this) but the interior is complete. Booked the room on Priceline for $79, and received a well-decorated though small corner room with a bizarrely large closet. Rooms come equipped with flat screen TVs, and iPod clock radios (bring your own iPod). Everything was clean and tidy overall. The hotel throws in free parking with your room, so considering the usual hotel parking rates of $20 or more, it's an excellent throw-in. They also include a complimentary continental breakfast served in large room near the lounge. Good basic fixings - hot and cold cereal, toast, bagels, danishes, apples, bananas, coffee, tea. The one drawback may be the university district neighbourhood. There is almost no street life around the hotel, not much in way of shops or restaurants. There's a Tully's in the lobby that closes by 6 pm, a Safeway a few blocks away that's open late, and a movie theatre. But the area is quiet at night, not neccessarily in a good way. There was some police activity one night, and in general, the area doesn't have a great reputation in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: emptynestersrus
Reviews.Content: Our son just graduated from the University of Washington and we needed a place to put our out of town guests coming to his commencement. We chose this hotel because it is so close to UW, but also is just a few minutes to all the downtown tourist attractions. It was the absolutely perfect choice! The hotel is gorgeous with a large lobby where family members can gather before heading out for the day, and the staff were amazing! Everyone we encountered was so friendly and helpful. My 75 year old parents need a lot of help getting around these days and everyone went out of their way to make sure they were comfortable. One of them even walked with my Dad to the local grocery store a few blocks away because he insisted on walking instead of taking the hotel's shuttle van, because they were worried that he wouldn't be able to carry the bags back by himself! Our family had a total of five rooms, and everyone of them has called me to thank me for choosing Hotel Deca - it will always be our first choice for our out fo town guests from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Superficially Nice, while Actually Quite Poor”
Reviews.Author: megabases
Reviews.Content: The place felt like a cheap one star hotel masquerading as a nicer hotel with its superficially chic, but cheap-on-closer inspection-art-deco furniture. I am a middle-aged professional that travels for business at least once a month. Hotel Deca looked like the appropriate place to stay, given its proximity to the University of Washington. I have probably stayed in over 100 hotels in the past 20 years. I have never met a staff so ignorant. My first question regarded gym facilities at the hotel. The staff person asked another: do we have a gym here? Each time I inquired about gym facilities, I received a different answer. I was constantly faced with inaccurate answers to my questions. I was incorrectly told that there were no laundry services. When I asked about restaurants nearby, I was told to: just walk down the street (it was night). When the wireless stopped working, I was told to: just purchase a cable from the front desk. I noted that perhaps some of the other guests would like to use the wireless service. The staff were well-meaning and friendly, but completely ill-prepared to perform their jobs, and unfamiliar with the norms for a hotel. On my second night I received no wash cloths, shampoo or conditioner. This problem was corrected by the night staff. The room was small, and there are no drawers for clothing, except for a small plastic one at the bottom of the closet. I emailed the manager of this hotel, but received no reply. Generally, unresponsive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: btworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Deca over the long weekend for three nights. The rooms are decorated beautifully and were very spacious. I would recommend a room that is high due to street noise. The bathroom was small and did not have a lock or a fan. This may not bother others but it was an issue for me. We did not find noise to be a problem. The best thing about this hotel is the location. We walked to a fantastic Italian restaurant and lots of really cool shops. There are all kinds of things to do within walking distance. This is a college area so it is quite colorful and I don't know if people with small children would like it. We have teenagers and they loved the area. All in all it was a good value for the money and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: patrickgowdy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Univ of Washington; but only a short drive to downtown. Free parking next to the hotel is a real plus. The young, but helpful staff were eager to please. The Bar/ Rest. in the basement (The District) did not have a broad menu; but the entrees they prepared were done well. I thought I would be put-off by the Art-Deco theme of the hotel, but it was not too obtrusive and I quickly got used to it. I like to walk for exercise and the area offered many options for walkers (or joggers for that matter). The hotel seemed to have mostly business types while I was there, but it would work well for families as well. The bed and bedding were first class. Would recommend the property. PGowdy

Reviews.Title: “Nice but underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: sakura_senshi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Deca for one night following a long drive through heavy Seattle traffic. Since I was exhausted I decided to take a short nap---and short it was indeed, because a teenaged girl began shrieking and running through the hallway outside of our room. To the hotel's credit, a security staffer came up and instructed the girls to stay in their room, but shortly after he left, the aforementioned girl was out giggling and running in the hallway. When I went down for dinner, I commented to the desk clerk about our noisy neighbors, and she said, "Sometimes things like that happen." I was speechless, but took that as a cue to seek dinner outside of the building. (The Deca has a small bistro in its basement, where we had lunch: the service was friendly, but the food was an overpriced disappointment. A small piece of grilled salmon was served over a large bed of lightly sauteed sliced onions and peppers. With 2 drinks, the total tab for the two of us came to over $30, and we left hungry. I also might add this hotel has no room service, so forget about breakfast in bed or late-night munchies in front of the flatscreen plasma TV that was in our premium room.) This is too bad, as the room we stayed in was pleasantly decorated and had plenty of space. We had a view of the city from our window, and the hotel is located very close to the University of Washington, where I was visiting. There is also free off-street parking, which is a lot to recommend in a town where parking averages $7 an hour. However, we were disappointed by the noise we could hear in our room. On one side we could hear our neighbors' television, while on the other, shrieking and giggling. Maybe a less noise-phobic guest would like this place: but I really need quiet to sleep well, so I didn't. Beware too, that the free continental breakfast is cleared away at 9 a.m. sharp---something that wasn't mentioned anywhere in the room---so you will miss out if you like sleeping in. I have to say I have visited Seattle many times and have stayed at several different hotels; I don't think I want to go back to this one. There are quieter places with far more amenities in that city.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great - but SMALL room”
Reviews.Author: DCAlexander
Reviews.Content: First the good news. We felt the location was great. My wife ran in the morning on the U Wash campus and it's beautiful. The library reading room there is amazing -- rivals NYC's public library. Lots of small restaurants nearby (NEVER have seen so many Asian type places in such close proximity -- e.g. literally two Vietnamese cafes a door apart). Trip into the city is easy and hotel has a free shuttle which we used one day. Very friendly and helpful staff. Free and easy parking, which is great. The art deco look is a little odd and strained at points, but I warmed up to it. The only bad news really is that our room, by the outside stairs, was itty bitty. Pay a little more for a larger room. It had one office-type chair, no light by the bed (in fact the only light was a lamp on the desk, so impossible to read in bed unless you move the lamp, which we did). Bathroom is so small that you can barely stand in it and close the door. But it was QUIET, which is a must for me and worth a lot. For the money, all in all, I can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome... and Gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbunnyhoney
Reviews.Content: Loved the art deco decor. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was fantastic. Couldn't be happier (except perhaps a larger bathroom). Can't wait to return.......it would definitely be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GoHawks78
Reviews.Content: My house had a power outage so I decided to spend a night at Hotel Deca. I stayed in one of their Deluxe Rooms, but in no way was it "deluxe". Maybe my expectations were too high, I was expecting more than a shoebox of a room and was surprised not to find a refrigerator or microwave! The room also lacked a safe which would have been nice. And the worst part for me was the tiny tiny bathroom. There was little space to set toiletries. The breakfast was bland, cold continental items and coffee. The breakfast was included as was wireless internet access, a plus! I would recommend this hotel if you are just looking for a place to sleep. If you are looking for something special or a hotel with extras, I do not recommend Hotel Deca.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Deca - Great!”
Reviews.Author: slobird
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! I read the other TA reviews on this hotel prior to selection and offer a few updates. But first my thoughts. Staff was very friendly and outgoing always asking if we needed anything and offering a smile with their "Enjoy your day." Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and the decor outstanding (okay, we are into the retro look and the Hotel Deca - rators did a great job). The lobby and seating areas were in the same style and just add to the classiness of building! There were concerns by others about the WiFi, but we had a signal strength of four bars (out of five) on the north side sixth floor. The rooms are a little smaller than average, but having said that, this is a 50's/60's building and as such the rooms were generally smaller in that era. Our feeling was that there was plenty of room for relaxing, sleeping and just hanging out. This hotel is not in the business district of Seattle. It is located in the University District which has its own character. A little funky with lots of ethnic restaurants, and we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Completely renovated, stylish, and clean!”
Reviews.Author: tttrip
Reviews.Content: After a very bad experience with another hotel in the Seattle area, we called around to various hotels and found Hotel Deca. Their rates were very competitive with other hotels in Seattle, and they were conveniently located just outside of the downtown area. One of the key factors was that Hotel Deca offerred free parking for our selected room type. Otherwise, parking in the downtown area would have added to the daily rate of other hotels. When we checked in, we found that the recently renovated hotel was very stylishly decorated and clean. The staff at the front desk was very professional and helpful. Free WiFi Internet access is available throughout the hotel, and I was able to get a good signal from my room. Bed linens, towels, carpet, and bathroom all were clean. Even the shampoo and soap had a pleasing uniqueness to them. The hotel room featured a large (approx 32") LCD TV with DVD player. The alarm clock was an iHome that had an iPod dock, which was a nice feature. The continental breakfast in the lounge was convenient for us to grab somethinig quick to eat in the morning. Though you are in the middle of a college town, it is a very quick drive to downtown Seattle (6-8 minutes) depending on traffic. There are the usual college type restaurants in the neighborhood and a rather good vegeterian restaurant called Aruya a block away. If you want to experience unique Seattle restaurants, then you'll probably want to venture downtown to Flying Fish or Wild Ginger. There are a couple comedy clubs in the hotel neighborhood if you are looking for some nighttime entertainment. We visited the Giggles comedy club, which was fairly priced at $12 with a one drink minimum (but we were also given complimentary passes to come back and see another show on another date). Overall, I would probably look here first if I were visiting Seattle again. The price is fair and the accommodations are great.

Reviews.Title: “This is a shocker”
Reviews.Author: StevenGerrards
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay for several nights at the end of our holiday. Arriving to find most of reception being renovated, and far from the luxury room that we had booked, the linen was not clean, the bathroom was a mess, and there were stains on the ceiling - this was a room in need of a makeover. Breakfast was a small offering, served on plastic plates with stale rolls. Not a pleasure. The neighborhood is also suspect after dark - we did not venture out, but there didn't appear to be anything in the way of decent food in the area. We checked out after one night and moved downtown, pleased to have escaped. The only excuse to stay here is if you are visiting relatives studying at UW - apart from that forget it, you will not enjoy the experience

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives, a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: Tgreen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the UT for five days while visiting our daughter. For the most part, the stay was very pleasant. The hotel was clean, well decorated and, most important, quiet for a large city. The rooms were a little on the small side and if I were to return, I would pay extra for a larger room. The location is excellent for anything in and around the University. It is a relatively easy walk to almost everything or, given the size of UW, as close to walking distance as you're likely to get. The negatives-wireless internet service was sporadic and very frustrating. Any connection you were able to make was precarious at best. Direct connection to the wall data port didn't work at all. We were told reception varies from room to room. More important, we were told that they were in the process of rewiring. If internet/email is important, you should inquire on the status before making a reservation. The second negative is probably more of a perception issue for us small town folks. The neighborhood right around the hotel appears to be a little suspect. The daytime was no problem but, at night, when we ventured out to enjoy the local neighborhood (lots of independent movie theaters, interesting bars and dining choices), I was a little nervous. Nothing happened and I am probably a little too cautious. Regardless, the hotel has a parking area that is well lit and appeared to be secure via video monitors and attendants. By the way, there is a lounge in the basement that has different ownership. (There is no room service.) We had dinner there one night and were pleasantly surprised. It doesn't look like much and it seemed to be having some growing pains, but the food was very good and fairly priced. All in all, I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again, assuming they have solved the internet issues.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler96817
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't that quite appeasing from the outside. But, the inside doesn't compare to the outside. The hotels interior is of creative sound like no other. It has a fireplace in the lobby with lots of lounge chairs and the rooms, elevators has this gothic theme to it, which was really cool. Our room had the view of WU. It had a ref. and a micro. which was really nice because most hotels don't provide. Although, we didn't read the daily paper, it came in before we even woke up. Aside from the complimentary breakfast and parking, they also had complimentary internet access in the lobby to check your email or print out your flight confirmation or anything. I think for the price we paid was still. This hotel is the by far the best hotel we've stayed at in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “If only they had better linens”
Reviews.Author: wanda&ted
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-night stay at the University Tower hotel. We were dropping our daughter off to UW, so the location was perfect. It was within walking distance to everything related to the university. For the price we paid, it was very comparable to other like hotels. The price also included free parking and a continental breakfast. The breakfast was mainly breads, cereals, some fruits, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. Just the basics, but presented in a very nice room that had both small tables and sofa areas. Attached to the lobby is a Tullys coffee shop. In the lobby are two computers that you can use to get on the internet for free. You can print five pages for free and additional pages for fifteen cents each. They were a bit slow, but, hey... it was free. Overall, the service was very very good. The front desk workers were all nice and competent. Even the people in Tullys were very good. When we arrived, our toilet was clogged. They immediately sent up someone with a plunger. He fixed the problem quickly, but left the floor totally wet. We had to call him back to dry it. Our room was very tiny with a queen bed. The bathroom was tiny, also, but clean. Because the room is so small, the bed is pushed up against one wall. Some people don't like to sleep up against a wall. The climate control seemed fine, but better yet, there were two small windows that you could open for fresh air. The only real complaint that we had was the low quality linens. The sheets were thin and felt like a blend. If you like the luxury of nice cotton sheets and towels, then these won't do. The thin blanket seemed rather cheap, too. At least the mattress was comfortable. It looked as if either the management or, at least, the name of the hotel is about to change soon. Hopefully, they improve the linens at that time, too.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: chuston
Reviews.Content: We loved the University Tower Hotel. We booked it not knowing where to stay in Seattle. We decided not to stay downtown because it would be too touristy, and this hotel was just what we wanted. We are a young 30's couple, and this hotel fit us to a T! Here's the bad, the rooms are small-but really who is in their room that much, and the pillows are VERY fluffy, but some of you may like that. Now the good-The beds are great! The room is super cute and quiet. They have a great breakfast in the morning and are walkable to tons of cute restaurants and shops in the University District. I recommend going to AquaVerde, just a few blocks away to sit out on the water and drink margarita's personally! It's about a 5-10 min drive downtown depending on traffic, but its nice because you miss most of heavy downtown traffic.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: andyinaz
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed. Decent standard room with modern looking style. Very clean. Only downside is the inner walls are thin; could hear adjacent rooms but not traffic. Conveniently located to University area (short walk) restaurants/bars/museums, short drive to downtown Seattle (15 mins. non-traffic), and easy access to I-5. Pleasant staff. Free parking on site which is great compared to some downtown locations. No surprises with continental breakfast. $150/day rate seemed reasonable with competitors.

Reviews.Title: “What a find! Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised because we thought the price would reflect a run down hotel compared to the price we paid downtown for the W. Free internet in the lobby, great breakfast, stylish rooms and very comfortable beds. Bathroom was small and a little dark, but shower was good. Lobby area has a fireplace and many sitting areas with cool furniture. The free parking is also a bonus - there is a big parking lot behind the hotel for easy in, easy out. Staff nice. The cab ride downtown to eat was around $16 each way, but the money saved on the room fee makes up for being a little out of the loop from downtown. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor”
Reviews.Author: Metwo3
Reviews.Content: The nicest feature of this hotel is the decor--art deco. It is very stylish. The staff was friendly and helptul. The lobby has actually usable private conversation and lounging areas. The room was small in square footage, but fine. The bath was small and the limited in counter space as it had a pedestal sink and small shelf. The bed was comfortable. I agree with the complaint about the a/c. We too faced the west and had to draw the heavy curtains and turn the a/c on to make it even bearable, never cool. We would have opened the window at night, but the street noise from 45th was loud and constant all night. You might get less of a view, but also less noise if you are located over the parking lot. The continental breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “A Surprisingly Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently went on vacation to Seattle last week and stayed at the University Hotel, which I book on Expedia for $129/night. The University Hotel was surprisingly a lot nicer than I thought it was going to be and the hotel staff were very friendly and professional. We checked in at around 1 a.m. and the front desk staff was surprisingly very pleasant at such a late hour. The decor reminded me a lot of what you would find in a Kimpton Hotel and had a boutique feel. Unfortunately the location is not all that great if you do not have a car with you and want to be in downtown Seattle; although the drive is only about 5 minutes. There is however a bus stop a block away you can take downtown. Also another great thing about the University Hotel is that they have a binder filled with take-out menus, from which you can order from local eateries and have it delivered to your room to satisfy whatever cuisine you crave. I would definitely recommend the University Hotel for the great rate I got, which I think is a lot nicer than a hotel you would get at $129/night in downtown Seattle. The rooms were very comfortable and clean with a boutique feel; they also come equipped with a refridgerator and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: kilian2004
Reviews.Content: We spend three nights in the UT Hotel and did not regret it. Really nice atmosphere rooms are clean and tidy and freshly renovated, though not too big (at least ours was not). Complimentary continental breakfast is offered and in the bar we could enjoy a very good Jazz quintett together with fine beers from the tap. A bus stop is just round the corner which takes you within 15 minutes to downtown Seattle and if you feel like dining in the University District I can recomment the Indian restaurant which is just round the corner (behind the hotel owned parking lot). Considering that parking is included in the room rate this is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best views of Seattle and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: UKLass09
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel experiences I have had while staying in Seattle! We booked a room on a higher floor and hd views of the city that where fantastic. The staff were very helpful and being so close to major road ways helped to get all around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Seatowntraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for an interview at UW hospital so it's an ideal location if your travel involves the university. I'm from NYC so I'm used to walking everywhere, so it is within walkable distance to the entire campus within 15-20 minutes. The rooms are very well decorated, clean and mine had a great view of the city. There is a great bar in the basement of the hotel, a coffee shop on the first floor, a great lobby, and a place near the reception to check email which was great. My only complaint was that the walls were a little thin and I could hear my neighbors talking at times throughout the night but it may be because it was adjoining rooms. I'm not sure if all rooms are like this. Parking is free and it is about a 10-15 minute ride to downtown Seattle from this hotel during the day (maybe longer, traffic can be pretty bad). Overall, a little pricey, but worth the money for a pleasant stay.
